English: Paul, a bondservant of Jesus Christ, called to be an apostle, separated to the gospel of God
Bahnar: Inh Pôl chih hơpong kơ iĕm bơngai Rôm. Inh bơngai đĭch đam Yêsu Krist. 'Bok Kei-Dei krao inh pơm jơ̆ng 'bang Sư, wă kơ inh năm chă bơtho kơ đe tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng Sư.

English: which He promised before through His prophets in the Holy Scriptures
Bahnar: Hơdrol kơ Yêsu jur sơ̆ 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r Sư chih roi lê̆ hơdrol tơdrong noh tơ lăm sơ̆p hla bơar Sư.

English: concerning His Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who was born of the seed of David according to the flesh
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng noh roi gah Kon Sư Yêsu Krist mă pơm Yŏng bơ̆n. Yêsu Krist jur jing kon bơngai Sư lĕch đơ̆ng adrĕch pơtao Đawit sơ̆.

English: and declared to be the Son of God with power according to the Spirit of holiness, by the resurrection from the dead.
Bahnar: Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơbăt ăn kơ bơ̆n Yêsu Yang, Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei. Sư tơbăt ăn kơ bơ̆n tơdrong Yêsu Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei, Sư tơ'bôh kơ bơ̆n 'bôh Sư mơsêh mơyang gơh iung arih đơ̆ng lôch. 'Noh bơ̆n băt kơ Yêsu Sư Yang tơpă.

English: Through Him we have received grace and apostleship for obedience to the faith among all nations for His name
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang Yêsu Krist mơnat kơ inh, ăn kơ inh pơm jơ̆ng 'bang Sư, wă kơ inh năm bơtho kơ đĭ-đăng khŭl bơngai jơ̆p kơ teh đak, wă kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai lui kơ Sư păng ư-ang kơ Sư ling-lang.

English: among whom you also are the called of Jesus Christ
Bahnar: Na 'Bok Kei-Dei krao iŏk iĕm bơngai Rôm, wă kơ iĕm lui kơ Yêsu Krist mơ̆n.

English: To all who are in Rome, beloved of God, called to be saints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Bahnar: Na dang ei inh chih kơthơ ăn kơ iĕm bơngai Rôm mă 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm kơeng. Iĕm boih 'Bok Kei-Dei krao wă kơ iĕm jing kon Sư. Inh krao khan apinh Sư 'Bă tơm bơ̆n hăm Kră Yang bơ̆n Yêsu Krist wei-lăng iĕm tôm tơdrong wă kơ Sư ăn kơ iĕm hiôk-hian ling-lang.

English: First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ for you all, that your faith is spoken of throughout the whole world.
Bahnar: Hơdrol kơ inh wă pơma, inh đei tơdrong bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei hơdrol 'mơ̆i. Yua kơ Yêsu Krist lôch tang bơ̆n na bơ̆n băt krao khan bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Inh bơnê kơ Sư yua kơ Sư ăn kơ iĕm lui kơjăp. Đĭ kơ bơngai lui jơ̆p kơ teh đak kư̆m băt kơ iĕm lui kơjăp tơpă.

English: For God is my witness, whom I serve with my spirit in the gospel of His Son, that without ceasing I make mention of you always in my prayers
Bahnar: Inh adrin jang tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei, bơtho tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng Kon Sư Yêsu Krist, na 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư 'bôh inh krao khan kơ Sư, Sư băt kơ inh krao khan tơgŭm iĕm ling-lang tơpă.

English: making request if, by some means, now at last I may find a way in the will of God to come to you.
Bahnar: Inh krao khan apinh Sư pơchoh kơ inh trong wă kơ inh gơh năm ngôi hơpong hăm iĕm.

English: For I long to see you, that I may impart to you some spiritual gift, so that you may be established
Bahnar: Inh 'maih năm tơ iĕm dêh, wă kơ inh gơh tơgŭm iĕm lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei rai kơjăp hloh.

English: that is, that I may be encouraged together with you by the mutual faith both of you and me.
Bahnar: Inh wă kơ bơ̆n pơm thoi âu: Inh 'maih năm tơ iĕm wă kơ bơ̆n gơh tơgŭm dih băl, wă kơ inh 'bôh tơdrong lui iĕm, iĕm 'bôh tơdrong lui inh, noh na bơ̆n lui rai kơjăp hloh.

English: Now I do not want you to be unaware, brethren, that I often planned to come to you (but was hindered until now), that I might have some fruit among you also, just as among the other Gentiles.
Bahnar: Ơ 'nhŏng oh, inh khan tơbăt ăn kơ iĕm tơdrong inh khan wă năm ngôi hơpong tơ iĕm lơ 'măng boih mă ưh kơ yĕng. Inh 'maih bơtho 'biơ̆ pơlei iĕm, wă kơ đei bơngai lui rai lơ thoi lu kon pơlei nai mă ưh kơ khŭl Juđê, lu sư lui đơ̆ng inh bơtho.

English: I am a debtor both to Greeks and to barbarians, both to wise and to unwise.
Bahnar: Inh oei hre kơ rim khŭl bơngai mă inh ưh tam năm chă bơtho tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng Yêsu Krist, mă bơngai Grĕk, mă bơngai nai, mă bơngai kơtul, mă bơngai hơgei, inh oei tă hre kơ sư ngăl.

English: So, as much as is in me, I am ready to preach the gospel to you who are in Rome also.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh na inh hưch hanh hmăng dah truh tơ iĕm wă bơtho tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng sư.

English: For I am not ashamed of the gospel of Christ, for it is the power of God to salvation for everyone who believes, for the Jew first and also for the Greek.
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng Yêsu Krist kăl tơpă na inh bơtho đe ưh kơ mơlâu. Tơdrong noh tơbăt ăn kơ bơ̆n 'Bok Kei-Dei mơsêh mơyang tơpă pơklaih bơ̆n đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch na ăn kơ bơ̆n oei hiôk hăm Sư. Thoi noh dôm lu bơngai lui kơ tơdrong noh 'Bok Kei-Dei pơklaih ngăl. Lu bơngai Juđê lui hơdrol, đơ̆ng noh lu bơngai nai lui.

English: For in it the righteousness of God is revealed from faith to faith; as it is written, “The just shall live by faith.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ bơ̆n lui kơ tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng Yêsu Krist, na 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ bơ̆n jing bơngai 'lơ̆ng hăm Sư. Sư jô̆ bơ̆n thoi noh yua kơ minh tơdrong bơ̆n lui kơ Kon Sư đĕch. 'Noh kư̆m thoi đe roi lăm sơ̆p hla bơar Sư sơ̆ thoi âu: “Bơngai bu lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ sư bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt ăn kơ sư arih ling-lang.”

English: For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men, who suppress the truth in unrighteousness
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei oei tơ plĕnh ti, Sư 'bôh tôm tơdrong kon bơngai pơm yoch pơm kơnê̆ tơpă, na Sư ơh wă phak kon bơngai. Kon bơngai lăp đon kơ pơm tơdrong kơnê̆, thoi noh na lu sư nŏng kơ pơgăn lê̆ lu bôl sư wă kiơ̆ tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: because what may be known of God is manifest in them, for God has shown it to them.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei tơbăt kơ kon bơngai nhên dêh boih gah tơdrong Sư đei tơpă.

English: For since the creation of the world His invisible attributes are clearly seen, being understood by the things that are made, even His eternal power and Godhead, so that they are without excuse
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng Sư pơjing plĕnh teh sơ̆ khơ̆ dang ei kon bơngai băt tôm tơmam đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei ngăl. Thoi noh kon bơngai băt nhên kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư Yang tơm mơsêh mơyang ưh kơ tôch. Mă-lei kon bơngai bơ̆n oei khan ưh kơ đei 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mơ̆i, kon bơngai bơ̆n hơlĕnh dêh tơpă.

English: because, although they knew God, they did not glorify Him as God, nor were thankful, but became futile in their thoughts, and their foolish hearts were darkened.
Bahnar: Kon bơngai bơ̆n băt kơ đei 'Bok Kei-Dei, mă-lei kuă bơnê ư-ang kơ Sư, thoi noh kon bơngai bơ̆n tơchĕng rai ưh kơ tơpăt rai kơtul jing măng mu.

English: Professing to be wise, they became fools
Bahnar: Đon bơ̆n tơchĕng kơdih khan bơ̆n hơgei, mă tơpă bơ̆n kơtul dêh.

English: and changed the glory of the incorruptible God into an image made like corruptible man—and birds and four-footed animals and creeping things.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei mơsêh mơyang tih-tin arih ling-lang mă kuă kơ kơkuh kơ Sư, na man kơdih rup kon bơngai rup sem brem, noh boih kơkuh khan yang.

English: Therefore God also gave them up to uncleanness, in the lusts of their hearts, to dishonor their bodies among themselves
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh na 'Bok Kei-Dei achăng lê̆ bơ̆n gô mơ̆ng kơ bơ̆n wă pơm, pơm kơnê̆ bưh kiơ bưh. Bơ̆n pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ truh tơ akâu bơ̆n ưh kơ băt mơlâu kơ đe.

English: who exchanged the truth of God for the lie, and worshiped and served the creature rather than the Creator, who is blessed forever. Amen.
Bahnar: Kuă kơ kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei mă arih ling-lang, kơkuh kơ rup yang mă ưh kơ arih. Bơ̆n wă kơkuh kơ đêl tơmam Sư pơjing, kuă kơ kơkuh kơ tơ'ngla Sư mă gơh pơjing tôm tơdrong. 'Bok Kei-Dei boih trŏ kơ bơ̆n ư-ang ling-lang ưh kơ đei layơ tôch. A-men.

English: For this reason God gave them up to vile passions. For even their women exchanged the natural use for what is against nature.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh na 'Bok Kei-Dei achăng lê̆ bơ̆n pơm kơnê̆ bưh kiơ bưh, na bơ̆n pơm kơnê̆ kư̆ kă tơpă. Roi gah tơdrong drŏ-kăn: Đei lu drŏ-kăn mơ'nah rai pă 'maih iŏk klo kiơ̆ thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă. Lu sư wă pơm kư̆ kă tơduă lu sư đĕch.

English: Likewise also the men, leaving the natural use of the woman, burned in their lust for one another, men with men committing what is shameful, and receiving in themselves the penalty of their error which was due.
Bahnar: Lu drŏ-nglo kư̆m lei-lăi. Đei lu drŏ-nglo mơ'nah kư̆m rai pă 'maih iŏk akăn kiơ̆ thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă. Lu sư wă pơm kư̆ kă tơduă lu sư mơ̆n. Yua kơ lu sư pơm yoch dêh, na 'Bok Kei-Dei phak lu sư ăn kơ lu sư đei tơdrong gleh.

English: And even as they did not like to retain God in their knowledge, God gave them over to a debased mind, to do those things which are not fitting
Bahnar: Yua kơ bơ̆n kuă kơ kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang tih-tin na 'Bok Kei-Dei achăng lê̆ bơ̆n ăn kơ bơ̆n jing kơtul pơm yoch ling-lang.

English: being filled with all unrighteousness, sexual immorality, wickedness, covetousness, maliciousness; full of envy, murder, strife, deceit, evil-mindedness; they are whisperers
Bahnar: Kon bơngai bơ̆n pơm tôm tơdrong kơnê̆, tôm tơdrong yoch tơpă. Bơ̆n 'nhĕng tơmam đe, bơ̆n areh dih băl, bơ̆n tơgar sa băl, pơlôch dih băl, tơteh dih băl, plơ̆ plĕch kơ bôl buăl; jơhngơ̆m 'maih hil kơ đe, wă bâu roi đe

English: backbiters, haters of God, violent, proud, boasters, inventors of evil things, disobedient to parents
Bahnar: pơjăm pơjuă dih băl. 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư Kră Yang, bơ̆n kư̆m areh kơ Sư mơ̆n. Bơ̆n bơngai hơwĕng dêh, bơ̆n pơ'brơh kơ đe, bơ̆n pơang akâu kơ đe, jơhngơ̆m bơ̆n 'bĕnh kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ ling-lang. Mĕ 'bă kơdih kư̆m ưh kơ băt kơ chu yom.

English: undiscerning, untrustworthy, unloving, unforgiving, unmerciful
Bahnar: Bơ̆n pơm tôm tơdrong kơnê̆ kư̆ kă, đon bơ̆n jing ưh kơ tơpăt nŏng kơ hơlĕnh kơ đe ling-lang, ưh kơ băt mơnat kơ bôl buăl tŏ sĕt.

English: who, knowing the righteous judgment of God, that those who practice such things are deserving of death, not only do the same but also approve of those who practice them.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n băt kơ ning-mônh 'Bok Kei-Dei wă phak dôm lu bơngai thoi noh ră, mă-lei bơ̆n kư̆m oei pơm khŏm khŏm thoi noh. Bơ̆n 'bôh đe pơm yoch thoi noh, bơ̆n khan tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơdrong trŏ.

English: Therefore you are inexcusable, O man, whoever you are who judge, for in whatever you judge another you condemn yourself; for you who judge practice the same things.
Bahnar: Lăm lu iĕm mơ'nah jô̆ kơ đe pơm yoch, iĕm ưh kơ gơh khan kơ đe thoi noh ôh, yua kơ iĕm kư̆m hơdai pơm yoch lei-lăi. Iĕm jô̆ kơ đe pơm yoch noh dang iĕm khan kơ akâu iĕm kơdih pơm yoch.

English: But we know that the judgment of God is according to truth against those who practice such things.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n băt boih 'Bok Kei-Dei wă phak dôm lu bơngai pơm yoch trŏ tơpă.

English: And do you think this, O man, you who judge those practicing such things, and doing the same, that you will escape the judgment of God?
Bahnar: Iĕm jô̆ kơ đe pơm yoch, iĕm kư̆m pơm yoch mơ̆n, iĕm tơchĕng iĕm pơm yoch 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ phak ôh hă, na iĕm jô̆ kơ đe pơm yoch?

English: Or do you despise the riches of His goodness, forbearance, and longsuffering, not knowing that the goodness of God leads you to repentance?
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ ăn kơ iĕm tơdrong gleh yua kơ iĕm ưh kơ đei tơdrong yoch hă? Ưh ôh. Sư ưh kơ ăn kơ iĕm tơdrong gleh yua kơ Sư wă kơ iĕm jah tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch ră. Sư mơnat kơ iĕm tơpă na Sư ăn kơ iĕm oei hiôk khŏm khŏm. Mă-lei iĕm oei pơm yoch hơnơ̆ng đĕch ưh kơ đei tơbral ôh.

English: But in accordance with your hardness and your impenitent heart you are treasuring up for yourself wrath in the day of wrath and revelation of the righteous judgment of God
Bahnar: Iĕm arăng kơ̆l tơpă na ưh kơ jah tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch, thoi noh na rai đunh rai đei tơdrong yoch tih, na mưh truh năr 'Bok Kei-Dei sek tơlang ning-mônh Sư phak iĕm kư̆m tih thoi tơdrong yoch iĕm pơm noh mơ̆n.

English: who “will render to each one according to his deeds”
Bahnar: Sư gô sek tơlang 'blep dôm tơdrong đêl bơ̆n pơm.

English: eternal life to those who by patient continuance in doing good seek for glory, honor, and immortality
Bahnar: Bơngai bu adrin pơm 'lơ̆ng hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei wă kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei lăp đon ăn kơ sư arih hiôk chơt păng wă kơ akâu sư huay kơ lôch hiong, bơngai noh 'Bok Kei-Dei gô ăn kơ sư đei tơdrong arih ling-lang tơpă.

English: but to those who are self-seeking and do not obey the truth, but obey unrighteousness—indignation and wrath
Bahnar: Bơngai bu băt 'mêm kơ akâu sư kơdih, ưh kơ 'mêm kơ tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei, sư wă kiơ̆ tơdrong kơnê̆ ngăl, bơngai noh 'Bok Kei-Dei gô phak sư kơtang kơtĭt tơpă.

English: tribulation and anguish, on every soul of man who does evil, of the Jew first and also of the Greek
Bahnar: Mă bơngai Juđê, mă bơngai nai, dah ưh kơ chu yom kơ nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei, oei wă pơm kơnê̆ ling-lang, lu bơngai thoi noh 'Bok Kei-Dei wă phak lu sư pơmat-tat tơpă ning-mônh.

English: but glory, honor, and peace to everyone who works what is good, to the Jew first and also to the Greek.
Bahnar: Mă bơngai Juđê, mă bơngai nai, dah lu sư pơm 'lơ̆ng hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei, ning-mônh 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ lu bơ̆n oei hơdai hăm Sư hiôk chơt ling-lang.

English: For there is no partiality with God.
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm kơ kon bơngai lei-lăi đĕch, ưh kơ phara ôh.

English: For as many as have sinned without law will also perish without law, and as many as have sinned in the law will be judged by the law
Bahnar: Lu bơngai khŭl nai, lu sư ưh kơ băt kơ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă kơ lu bơngai Juđê sơ̆, na lu sư oei pơm yoch khŏm khŏm, ning-mônh 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m phak lu sư mơ̆n. Lu bơngai Juđê băt ră kơ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă noh, mă-lei lu sư oei pơm yoch, ning-mônh 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m phak lu sư mơ̆n, yua kơ lu sư ưh kơ kiơ̆ tơdrong Sư pơkă.

English: (for not the hearers of the law are just in the sight of God, but the doers of the law will be justified
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ bơ̆n bơngai 'lơ̆ng, ưh kơ sĭ yua kơ bơ̆n kơtơ̆ng tơdrong Sư pơkă đĕch ôh, yua kơ bơ̆n kiơ̆ tơdrong noh.

English: for when Gentiles, who do not have the law, by nature do the things in the law, these, although not having the law, are a law to themselves
Bahnar: Lu bơngai khŭl nai, lu sư ưh kơ băt tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă, mă-lei lu sư mơ'nah pơm trŏ kơ tơdrong noh, yua kơ lăm to sư tơchĕng trŏ, na sư pơm kiơ̆ hloi.

English: who show the work of the law written in their hearts, their conscience also bearing witness, and between themselves their thoughts accusing or else excusing them)
Bahnar: Bơ̆n 'bôh sư pơm tơdrong trŏ na bơ̆n băt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ sư kơnăl tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆. Dah sư pơm yoch sư kư̆m băt kơdih pơm yoch. Dah sư pơm 'lơ̆ng sư kư̆m băt kơdih pơm 'lơ̆ng mơ̆n.

English: in the day when God will judge the secrets of men by Jesus Christ, according to my gospel.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh na mưh truh năr 'Bok Kei-Dei sek tơlang ning-mônh, Sư gô pơjao kơ Kon Sư Yêsu Krist sek tơlang kơ đĭ dôm tơdrong kon bơngai wă ôn. Inh khan kơ iĕm thoi noh yua kơ 'blep trŏ thoi tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei wă kơ inh bơtho.

English: Indeed you are called a Jew, and rest on the law, and make your boast in God
Bahnar: Lu iĕm bơngai Juđê mơ'nah oei pơang bơngai Juđê iĕm, khan iĕm kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă sơ̆ na khan 'Bok Kei-Dei wei-lăng iĕm ling-lang.

English: and know His will, and approve the things that are excellent, being instructed out of the law
Bahnar: Iĕm băt boih 'Bok Kei-Dei wă kơ iĕm pơm thoi yơ păng iĕm kư̆m băt tơdrong trŏ dah tơdrong glăi, yua kơ iĕm pơhrăm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei đơ̆ng đe bơtho iĕm boih.

English: and are confident that you yourself are a guide to the blind, a light to those who are in darkness
Bahnar: Iĕm khan iĕm pơm 'bok bơtho lu bơngai ưh kơ hlôh kiơ̆ tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă tơ'bôh trong kơ bơngai măt tol păng pơm ŭnh pơchrang hơdah kơ lu bơngai măng mu.

English: an instructor of the foolish, a teacher of babes, having the form of knowledge and truth in the law.
Bahnar: Iĕm bơtho lu bơngai ưh kơ hlôh păng lu bơngai oei moh. Păng iĕm băt tôm tơdrong hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma trŏ tơpă.

English: You, therefore, who teach another, do you not teach yourself? You who preach that a man should not steal, do you steal?
Bahnar: Mă-lei iĕm bơtho ăn kơ đe đĕch, akâu iĕm kơdih ưh kơ kiơ̆ ôh. Iĕm kuă kơ kiơ bơtho akâu iĕm kơdih? Na iĕm bơtho đe khan: 'Nĕ kơ tơtông. Bĭ iĕm hăm tơtông?

English: You who say, “Do not commit adultery,” do you commit adultery? You who abhor idols, do you rob temples?
Bahnar: Iĕm bơtho đe 'nĕ pơm pơyô kư̆ kă, na bĭ iĕm hăm pơm? Iĕm hil kơ đe kơkuh kơ rup yang. Bĭ iĕm hăm tơtông iŏk tơmam đe kơkuh kơ rup yang noh ưh?

English: You who make your boast in the law, do you dishonor God through breaking the law?
Bahnar: Iĕm khan kơ đe khan iĕm băt tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă 'lơ̆ng tơpăt mă-lei iĕm oei pơm yoch, ưh kơ kiơ̆ tơdrong Sư pơkă noh. Iĕm pơm thoi noh đe rai pơjăm 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: For “the name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles because of you,” as it is written.
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh 'blep thoi sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆ khan thoi âu: “Lu bơngai tơmoi nai pơjăm 'Bok Kei-Dei yua kơ lu bơngai Juđê ưh kơ kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă.”

English: For circumcision is indeed profitable if you keep the law; but if you are a breaker of the law, your circumcision has become uncircumcision.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm bơngai Juđê kăt tơdra akar khan kăl tơpă wă tơbăt kơ đe iĕm kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă truh um. Trŏ mơ̆n dah iĕm kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă truh um, lei tơdrong iĕm kăt tơdra akar noh kư̆m kăl mơ̆n. Mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ kiơ̆ tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă ôh, thoi noh tơdrong iĕm kăt tơdra akar dang ưh kơ yua ôh.

English: Therefore, if an uncircumcised man keeps the righteous requirements of the law, will not his uncircumcision be counted as circumcision?
Bahnar: Lu bơngai nai ưh kơ kăt tơdra akar, mă-lei dah lu sư kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă, 'Bok Kei-Dei lăng lu sư kư̆m dang lu sư kăt tơdra akar mơ̆n.

English: And will not the physically uncircumcised, if he fulfills the law, judge you who, even with your written code and circumcision, are a transgressor of the law?
Bahnar: Lu iĕm bơngai Juđê, 'Bok Kei-Dei chih pơkă ăn tơdrong juăt Sư đơ̆ng sơ̆ boih păng iĕm kư̆m kăt tơdra akar thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă mơ̆n. Mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt Sư pơkă kơ iĕm noh ôh. Tă tơ lu bơngai nai dơ̆ng ưh kơ kăt tơdra akar, mă-lei lu sư mơ'nah kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă hloh loi kơ iĕm dơ̆ng. Thoi noh ning-mônh lu sư gô jô̆ kơ iĕm bơngai yoch tơpă.

English: For he is not a Jew who is one outwardly, nor is circumcision that which is outward in the flesh
Bahnar: Mă sư bơngai Juđê, dah sư ưh kơ kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă, 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m ưh kơ jô̆ sư bơngai Juđê ôh. Mă sư kăt tơdra akar, dah sư ưh kơ kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă, 'Bok Kei-Dei lăng tơdrong sư kăt akar noh ưh kơ yua kiơ ôh.

English: but he is a Jew who is one inwardly; and circumcision is that of the heart, in the Spirit, not in the letter; whose praise is not from men but from God.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu wă kiơ̆ tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei, sư kiơ̆ hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m đon sư, bơngai noh 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ sư bơngai Juđê. Dah bơ̆n adrin kiơ̆ Sư hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m klơm klak, 'nĕ kiơ̆ pôm 'bơ̆r, bơngai noh 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ dang sư kăt tơdra akar mơ̆n. Dah bơ̆n pơm thoi noh, bơ̆n ưh kơ kăl kơ kon bơngai lăp đon kơ bơ̆n ôh, yua kơ bơ̆n đei 'Bok Kei-Dei lăp đon kơ bơ̆n boih.

English: What advantage then has the Jew, or what is the profit of circumcision?
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh thoi noh boih, tơ̆ng lei bĭ bơngai Juđê hăm tih hloh kơ bơngai nai, dah lei-lăi đĕch? Păng tơdrong kăt tơdra akar hăm mah yua kiơ?

English: Much in every way! Chiefly because to them were committed the oracles of God.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê tih hloh kơ lu bơngai nai 'biơ̆ mơ̆n yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei chih pơkă kơ lu sư tơdrong juăt Sư hơdrol kơ lu bơngai nai păng pơkă khan wă tơgŭm lu sư tơpă.

English: For what if some did not believe? Will their unbelief make the faithfulness of God without effect?
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m băt mơ̆n lu sư mơ'nah ưh kơ wă lui kơ tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ lu sư noh; mă lu sư ưh kơ lui, bơ̆n 'nĕ tơchĕng khan 'Bok Kei-Dei wă tŭk dôm tơdrong Sư pơkă wă tơgŭm noh, ưh ôh.

English: Certainly not! Indeed, let God be true but every man a liar. As it is written: “That You may be justified in Your words, And may overcome when You are judged.”
Bahnar: Đêl Sư pơkă lê̆ hơdrol Sư gô pơm 'blep thoi Sư pơkă tơpă. Mă kon bơngai bơ̆n juăt kơ hơlĕnh kơ Sư, kuă kơ kiơ̆ 'bơ̆r đon Sư mă-lei Sư oei pơm 'blep kơ nơ̆r Sư pơkă đĕch, Sư ưh kơ hơlĕnh thoi bơ̆n ôh. Na tơdrong noh 'blep thoi tơdrong đe chih roi lê̆ sơ̆ tơpă, sư khan thoi âu: “Ơ Kră Yang, Ih pơma 'lơ̆ng, pơma tơpăt ling-lang. Na kon bơngai wă sek tơlang tơdrong Ih, mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ gơh sek tơlang thoi yơ, yua kơ Ih pơm tơpăt kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r Ih pơkă ngăl.”

English: But if our unrighteousness demonstrates the righteousness of God, what shall we say? Is God unjust who inflicts wrath? (I speak as a man.)
Bahnar: Bơ̆n 'bôh tôm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt ngăl boih, na bơ̆n 'nĕ tơchĕng khan, bơ̆n pơm kơnê̆ kư̆m bưh, wă kơ đe kơnăl kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt păng wă kơ đe kơnăl kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư ưh kơ pơm kơnê̆ thoi kon bơngai. Bơ̆n pơm kơnê̆ noh na đe gô ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei rai tih, na dah 'Bok Kei-Dei wă phak bơ̆n ning-mônh noh Sư wă hơlĕnh đĕch yua kơ bơ̆n dang ư-ang anăn Sư kơ đe boih. Bơ̆n 'nĕ tơchĕng tơdrong noh khan trŏ, ưh ôh hŏ. Kon bơngai bơ̆n đĕch tơchĕng khan trŏ.

English: Certainly not! For then how will God judge the world?
Bahnar: Dah bơ̆n khan 'Bok Kei-Dei sek tơlang ưh kơ tơpăt, lei thoi yơ jơ̆p kơ teh đak chu kơ Sư sek tơlang mơ̆n.

English: For if the truth of God has increased through my lie to His glory, why am I also still judged as a sinner?
Bahnar: Bơ̆n 'bôh dôm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm trŏ thoi Sư pơkă ngăl boih, na bơ̆n 'nĕ tơchĕng khan, lê̆ bơ̆n pơma hơlĕnh kư̆m bưh, wă kơ đe băt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpăt. Na dah 'Bok Kei-Dei wă phak bơ̆n ning-mônh, noh Sư hơlĕnh đĕch, yua kơ bơ̆n dang ư-ang anăn Sư kơ đe boih. Bơ̆n tơchĕng thoi noh ưh kơ trŏ ôh, kon bơngai bơ̆n đĕch tơchĕng khan trŏ.

English: And why not say, “Let us do evil that good may come”?—as we are slanderously reported and as some affirm that we say. Their condemnation is just.
Bahnar: Mă tơdrong pơm kơnê̆ kư̆m lei-lăi. Bơ̆n 'nĕ pă tơchĕng khan trŏ. Na đei lu bơngai mơ'nah khan inh Pôl bơtho đe thoi noh; mă tơpă inh ưh kơ bơtho đe thoi noh ôh. Bơngai bu jô̆ kơ inh bơtho đe thoi noh, bơngai noh 'Bok Kei-Dei phak sư tơpă ning-mônh.

English: What then? Are we better than they? Not at all. For we have previously charged both Jews and Greeks that they are all under sin.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n 'nĕ pơang lu bơngai Juđê bơ̆n, khan bơ̆n bơngai ưh kơ yoch thoi lu bơngai nai. Yua kơ inh khan boih, đĭ-đăng kon bơngai yoch ngăl, na mă bơngai Juđê, mă bơngai khŭl nai.

English: As it is written: “There is none righteous, no, not one
Bahnar: 'Noh kư̆m thoi đe chih roi lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆ thoi âu: “Đĭ-đăng kon bơngai ưh kơ đei bu 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, hoh-hoy 'nhŏ kơ minh 'nu.

English: There is none who understands; There is none who seeks after God.
Bahnar: Păng ưh kơ đei bu hlôh wao tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei, yua kơ ưh kơ đei bu wă chă Sư.

English: They have all turned aside; They have together become unprofitable; There is none who does good, no, not one.”
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai jrok trong weh ataih đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei ngăl. Lu sư jing kơnê̆, ưh kơ đei bu tơpăt, hoh-hoy 'nhŏ kơ minh 'nu.

English: “Their throat is an open tomb; With their tongues they have practiced deceit”; “The poison of asps is under their lips”
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei lăng jơhngơ̆m kon bơngai kơnê̆ thoi lĕ kơ sơlŭng đe tah atâu ôm ưh kơ 'bŭ. Hơpiĕt kon bơngai băt pôm hơlĕnh kơ kơdih bôl. 'Bơ̆r kon bơngai dang 'bơ̆r 'bih 'maih choh đe.

English: “Whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness.”
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆r băt kơ hiap areh kơ đe.

English: “Their feet are swift to shed blood
Bahnar: Jơ̆ng kư̆m băt kơ chop pơlôch đe.

English: Destruction and misery are in their ways
Bahnar: Trong đêl lu sư yak năm tơblah băl mơhlik mơhlak.

English: And the way of peace they have not known.”
Bahnar: Kon bơngai ưh kơ băt chă tơdrong hiôk thoi yơ.

English: “There is no fear of God before their eyes.”
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ băt hli kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: Now we know that whatever the law says, it says to those who are under the law, that every mouth may be stopped, and all the world may become guilty before God.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n băt boih tơdrong đe chih noh sơ̆ ưh kơ trŏ jô̆ kơ lu bơngai nai đĕch pơm yoch ôh. Sư jô̆ kơ lu bơngai Juđê kư̆m pơm yoch mơ̆n, yua kơ sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei wă chih bơtho lu sư. 'Noh na lu bơngai Juđê bơ̆n băt boih, đĭ-đăng kon bơngai ưh kơ đei bu gơh khan sư bơngai ưh kơ yoch. Đĭ-đăng kon bơngai lăm teh đak yoch hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei ngăl boih.

English: Therefore by the deeds of the law no flesh will be justified in His sight, for by the law is the knowledge of sin.
Bahnar: Na mă bơngai Juđê mă bơngai nai, dah bơ̆n oei gơnang kơ akâu bơ̆n kơdih wă kiơ̆ dôm tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă sơ̆, 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ jô̆ bơ̆n bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt ôh, yua kơ tơdrong Sư pơkă noh sư pôm tơbăt kơ bơ̆n bơngai yoch hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch.

English: But now the righteousness of God apart from the law is revealed, being witnessed by the Law and the Prophets
Bahnar: Na dang ei 'Bok Kei-Dei wă tơ'bôh kơ bơ̆n tơdrong Sư wă ăn kơ kon bơngai jing 'lơ̆ng tơpăt. Sư jô̆ kon bơngai bơ̆n 'lơ̆ng tơpăt yua kơ bơ̆n lui kơ Yêsu, ưh kơ sĭ yua kơ bơ̆n gơnang kơ akâu kơdih wă kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă sơ̆ ôh. Tơdrong juăt Sư pơkă noh hăm lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r Sư sơ̆ tơbăt ăn kơ bơ̆n

English: even the righteousness of God, through faith in Jesus Christ, to all and on all who believe. For there is no difference
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ đĭ-đăng kon bơngai jing 'lơ̆ng yua kơ sư lui kơ Yêsu Krist. Yua kơ thoi noh na dang ei bơ̆n băt boih đĭ-đăng bơngai dang ăi đĕch

English: for all have sinned and fall short of the glory of God
Bahnar: đĭ-đăng kon bơngai weh ataih đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei kiơ̆ tơdrong yoch ngăl.

English: being justified freely by His grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei oei 'mêm kơ kon bơngai jô̆ kon bơngai jing 'lơ̆ng hăm Sư. Sư mơnat ăn đĕch. Yua kơ Sư mơnat na Sư ăn Yêsu Krist huai iŏk bơ̆n.

English: whom God set forth as a propitiation by His blood, through faith, to demonstrate His righteousness, because in His forbearance God had passed over the sins that were previously committed
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư sek tơlang kiơ̆ tơdrong tơpăt ngăl, na lu bơngai yoch Sư wă phak tơpă. Mă-lei Sư oei 'mêm kơ kon bơngai, na ăn Kon pôm Sư Yêsu lôch tang kon bơngai tơ 'long pơglang, wă huai iŏk lu bơngai yoch, wă kơ lu bơngai yoch noh lui kơ Kon Sư, gơnang kơ Kon Sư, na 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ lu sư jing bơngai 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, Sư huay pă jô̆ yo boih. Kơplah Yêsu tam mă lôch tang sơ̆, đei mơ̆n lu bơngai lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, gơnang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, mă-lei Sư huay kơ jô̆ yo ôh dôm tơdrong yoch lu sư, yua kơ Sư wă ăn Yêsu lôch tang lu sư ning-mônh. Tơdrong Sư ăn Kon Sư Yêsu lôch tang kon bơngai noh, Sư wă kơ kon bơngai băt kơ Sư sek tơlang kon bơngai tơpăt.

English: to demonstrate at the present time His righteousness, that He might be just and the justifier of the one who has faith in Jesus.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư sek tơlang kiơ̆ tơdrong tơpăt ngăl, na lu bơngai yoch Sư wă phak tơpă. Mă-lei Sư oei 'mêm kơ kon bơngai, na ăn Kon pôm Sư Yêsu lôch tang kon bơngai tơ 'long pơglang, wă huai iŏk lu bơngai yoch, wă kơ lu bơngai yoch noh lui kơ Kon Sư, gơnang kơ Kon Sư, na 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ lu sư jing bơngai 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, Sư huay pă jô̆ yo boih. Kơplah Yêsu tam mă lôch tang sơ̆, đei mơ̆n lu bơngai lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, gơnang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, mă-lei Sư huay kơ jô̆ yo ôh dôm tơdrong yoch lu sư, yua kơ Sư wă ăn Yêsu lôch tang lu sư ning-mônh. Tơdrong Sư ăn Kon Sư Yêsu lôch tang kon bơngai noh, Sư wă kơ kon bơngai băt kơ Sư sek tơlang kon bơngai tơpăt.

English: Where is boasting then? It is excluded. By what law? Of works? No, but by the law of faith.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na bơ̆n ưh kơ gơh pơang kơ đe khan bơ̆n bơngai 'lơ̆ng ôh yua kơ Sư jô̆ bơ̆n bơngai 'lơ̆ng kơlih kơ Sư mơnat đĕch. Mă-lei dah bơ̆n oei gơnang kơ akâu bơ̆n kơdih wă kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă, bơ̆n oei pơang akâu bơ̆n kơ đe ling-lang đĕch. Na dang ei bơ̆n lui kơ Yêsu Krist boih păng gơnang kơ Sư tơpă, thoi yơ bơ̆n gơh wă pơang kơ đe dơ̆ng?

English: Therefore we conclude that a man is justified by faith apart from the deeds of the law.
Bahnar: Kon bơngai bơ̆n hiôk 'lơ̆ng hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei yua kơ bơ̆n lui, ưh kơ sĭ yua kơ kĕ kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt Sư pơkă ôh.

English: Or is He the God of the Jews only? Is He not also the God of the Gentiles? Yes, of the Gentiles also
Bahnar: Bĭ iĕm tơchĕng thoi yơ, 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư Kră Yang lu bơngai Juđê đĕch dah lu bơngai nai hai? Sư Kră Yang lu bơngai nai hai mơ̆n.

English: since there is one God who will justify the circumcised by faith and the uncircumcised through faith.
Bahnar: Tơpă yua kơ đei lăp minh 'nu 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch. 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ bơ̆n bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt yua kơ bơ̆n lui kơ Sư, mă bơngai Juđê mă bơngai nai Sư jô̆ lei-lăi đĕch.

English: What then shall we say that Abraham our father has found according to the flesh?
Bahnar: Bĭ gah tơdrong Abraham sơ̆, 'bok tơm lu bơ̆n bơngai Juđê, bơ̆n tơchĕng tơdrong sư thoi yơ?

English: For if Abraham was justified by works, he has something to boast about, but not before God.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê juăt kơ ư-ang Abraham, khan Abraham kĕ kiơ̆ tôm tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă, na 'Bok Kei-Dei lăp đon kơ sư. Mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ tơchĕng thoi noh ôh.

English: For what does the Scripture say? “Abraham believed God, and it was accounted to him for righteousness.”
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei lăp đon yua kơ minh tơdrong sư lui đĕch. Bơ̆n băt tơdrong noh yua kơ sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei khan thoi âu: “Abraham đei đon lui păng gơnang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, na 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ sư bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.”

English: Now to him who works, the wages are not counted as grace but as debt.
Bahnar: Bĭ dah bơngai bu jang kơ đe, đe apah sư jên dah tơmam, noh ưh kơ sĭ đe mơnat ăn đĕch ôh, đe apah yua kơ tơdrong sư jang.

English: But to him who does not work but believes on Him who justifies the ungodly, his faith is accounted for righteousness
Bahnar: Bơ̆n bơngai yoch mă-lei dah bơ̆n lui păng gơnang kơ Sư tơpă, Sư kư̆m jô̆ bơ̆n bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt. Mă-lei noh ưh kơ sĭ Sư apah yua kơ bơ̆n kiơ̆ dôm tơdrong juăt Sư pơkă ôh, Sư mơnat yua kơ bơ̆n lui păng gơnang kơ Sư.

English: just as David also describes the blessedness of the man to whom God imputes righteousness apart from works
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'bok Đawit sơ̆ kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n. 'Bok Đawit khan dôm lu bơngai mă ưh kơ gơnang kơ akâu sư kơdih wă kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă, mă-lei gơnang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m mơnat jô̆ lu sư bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt na lu bơngai noh hiôk tơpă. Tơdrong sư pơma noh sơ̆ thoi âu

English: “Blessed are those whose lawless deeds are forgiven, And whose sins are covered
Bahnar: “Dôm lu bơngai mă 'Bok Kei-Dei pơklaih yoch, dôm lu bơngai noh boih pŭn dêh.

English: Blessed is the man to whom the LORD shall not impute sin.”
Bahnar: Dôm lu bơngai noh 'Bok Kei-Dei huay pă jô̆ yo kơ lu sư boih, na lu sư hiôk hơiă 'nă hal tơpă.”

English: Does this blessedness then come upon the circumcised only, or upon the uncircumcised also? For we say that faith was accounted to Abraham for righteousness.
Bahnar: Tơdrong pŭn noh ưh kơ sĭ Sư ăn pôm lu bơngai kăt tơdra akar đĕch ôh, Sư ăn kơ lu bơngai mă ưh kơ kăt tơdra akar hai mơ̆n, thoi bơ̆n băt boih 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ Abraham bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt yua kơ minh tơdrong sư lui đĕch.

English: How then was it accounted? While he was circumcised, or uncircumcised? Not while circumcised, but while uncircumcised.
Bahnar: Kơplah 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ kơ Abraham bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt noh sơ̆, đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Abraham kăt tơdra akar dah adrol kơ Abraham kăt tơdra akar? 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ sư bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt adrol kơ sư kăt tơdra akar ưh kơ sĭ đơ̆ng rŏng ôh.

English: And he received the sign of circumcision, a seal of the righteousness of the faith which he had while still uncircumcised, that he might be the father of all those who believe, though they are uncircumcised, that righteousness might be imputed to them also
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei athei Abraham kăt tơdra akar sơ̆, wă kơ tơbăt tơdra tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ sư bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt yua kơ sư lui păng gơnang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă. 'Bok Kei-Dei athei Abraham pơm thoi noh wă kơ Abraham pơm 'bă kơ 'bar khŭl bơngai. Khŭl mă mônh lu bơngai ưh kơ kăt tơdra akar, mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m jô̆ sư bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt yua kơ lu sư lui păng gơnang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă.

English: and the father of circumcision to those who not only are of the circumcision, but who also walk in the steps of the faith which our father Abraham had while still uncircumcised.
Bahnar: Khŭl mă 'bar wă khan lu bơngai mă kăt tơdra akar, 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ lu sư bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt mơ̆n, yua kơ lu sư lui kơjăp thoi 'bok Abraham bơ̆n lui adrol kơ sư kăt tơdra akar sơ̆.

English: For the promise that he would be the heir of the world was not to Abraham or to his seed through the law, but through the righteousness of faith.
Bahnar: Sơ̆ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă khan wă ăn kơ Abraham păng lu kon sâu sư pơgơ̆r jơ̆p kơ teh đak. 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă kơ Abraham thoi noh sơ̆ yua kơ Abraham lui păng gơnang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă, na 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ sư bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt; ưh kơ sĭ yua kơ Abraham kĕ kiơ̆ tôm tơdrong juăt Sư pơkă ôh.

English: For if those who are of the law are heirs, faith is made void and the promise made of no effect
Bahnar: Tơdrong pơgơ̆r teh đak, tơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ lu bơngai mă gơnang kơ akâu sư kơdih wă kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt Sư, lei dang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă ưh kơ 'blep kơ tơdrong Sư pơkă khan wă ăn kơ lu bơngai mă lui păng gơnang kơ Sư.

English: because the law brings about wrath; for where there is no law there is no transgression.
Bahnar: Dôm lu bơngai mă gơnang kơ akâu sư kơdih wă kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă sơ̆, lu sư trŏ kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă phak, yua kơ lu sư ưh kơ kĕ kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă. Tơ̆ng ưh kơ đei tơdrong juăt, bơ̆n ưh kơ băt pơm yoch kơ tơdrong juăt ôh.

English: Therefore it is of faith that it might be according to grace, so that the promise might be sure to all the seed, not only to those who are of the law, but also to those who are of the faith of Abraham, who is the father of us all
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă khan wă ăn kơ lu kon sâu Abraham pơgơ̆r jơ̆p kơ teh đak. Tơdrong Sư pơkă noh, Sư wă ăn kơ bơngai bu mă lui kơ Sư; yua kơ Sư mơnat, na Sư ăn. Lu bơngai Juđê mă adrin kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt Sư pơkă, wă khan lu bơngai mă gơnang kơ Sư hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m, lu bơngai noh Sư ăn. Mă-lei ưh kơ sĭ Sư ăn pôm lu đe noh đĕch ôh. Sư ăn kơ đĭ-đăng hăm lu bơngai tơmoi hai, wă khan lu bơngai mă lui 'blep trŏ thoi 'bok bơ̆n Abraham sơ̆. Thoi noh na Abraham boih pơm 'bok kơdră 'bă tơm đĭ-đăng kơ lu bơ̆n sơ̆.

English: (as it is written, “I have made you a father of many nations”) in the presence of Him whom he believed—God, who gives life to the dead and calls those things which do not exist as though they did
Bahnar: Yua kơ lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei khan sơ̆ thoi âu: “Inh gô ăn kơ ih pơm 'bă kơ đĭ-đăng teh đak.” 'Bok Kei-Dei khan thoi noh na Abraham lui kơ nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei, sư băt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei gơh ăn kơ bơngai lôch gơh iung arih păng gơh pơjing tôm tơdrong hăm nơ̆r Sư pơma đĕch.

English: who, contrary to hope, in hope believed, so that he became the father of many nations, according to what was spoken, “So shall your descendants be.”
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă wă ăn kơ sư pơm 'bă kơ đĭ-đăng teh đak păng khan kơ sư, kon sâu sư ning-mônh lơ thoi lĕ sơnglŏng tơ plĕnh. Kơplah noh sơ̆ Abraham sư đei minh-hrĕng sơnăm boih, mă-lei sư ưh tam mă đei kon ôh. Sư kră pă kĕ boih, akâu sư dang lĕ kơ lôch. Gah akăn sư yă Sara kư̆m kră mơ̆n păng sư akâu pôm tăm, thoi yơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă kơ sư khan pơm 'bă kơ đĭ-đăng teh đak? Tơdrong noh, tơ̆ng bơ̆n, ưh kơ gan wă lui ôh. Mă-lei sư lui kơ nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă kơ sư noh, sư ưh kơ hiơt ôh dôm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă.

English: And not being weak in faith, he did not consider his own body, already dead (since he was about a hundred years old), and the deadness of Sarah’s womb.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă wă ăn kơ sư pơm 'bă kơ đĭ-đăng teh đak păng khan kơ sư, kon sâu sư ning-mônh lơ thoi lĕ sơnglŏng tơ plĕnh. Kơplah noh sơ̆ Abraham sư đei minh-hrĕng sơnăm boih, mă-lei sư ưh tam mă đei kon ôh. Sư kră pă kĕ boih, akâu sư dang lĕ kơ lôch. Gah akăn sư yă Sara kư̆m kră mơ̆n păng sư akâu pôm tăm, thoi yơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă kơ sư khan pơm 'bă kơ đĭ-đăng teh đak? Tơdrong noh, tơ̆ng bơ̆n, ưh kơ gan wă lui ôh. Mă-lei sư lui kơ nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă kơ sư noh, sư ưh kơ hiơt ôh dôm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă.

English: He did not waver at the promise of God through unbelief, but was strengthened in faith, giving glory to God
Bahnar: Păng đon sư ưh kơ tơchĕng wă lui dah ưh ôh, sư kư̆ kơ lui dôm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă kơ sư rai đunh rai kơjăp, rai ư-ang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: and being fully convinced that what He had promised He was also able to perform.
Bahnar: Sư băt tơpă 'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơm 'blep thoi Sư pơkă wă ăn kơ sư.

English: And therefore “it was accounted to him for righteousness.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ sư lui na sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: “Abraham đei đon lui păng gơnang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, na 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ sư bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.”

English: Now it was not written for his sake alone that it was imputed to him
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdrong chih roi noh ưh kơ sĭ jô̆ kơ Abraham đĕch ôh.

English: but also for us. It shall be imputed to us who believe in Him who raised up Jesus our Lord from the dead
Bahnar: Sư jô̆ kơ bơ̆n hai mơ̆n, dah bơ̆n lui păng gơnang kơ Sư hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m klơm klak tơpă. Sư boih tơiung arih Yŏng bơ̆n Yêsu Krist đơ̆ng lôch.

English: Therefore, having been justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ
Bahnar: Bơ̆n lui păng gơnang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi noh, na Sư jô̆ bơ̆n jing 'lơ̆ng tơpăt; yua kơ Kră Yang bơ̆n Yêsu Krist na bơ̆n gơh oei hiôk hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: through whom also we have access by faith into this grace in which we stand, and rejoice in hope of the glory of God.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n lui kơ Yêsu Krist na 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm mơnat kơ bơ̆n. Sư ăn kơ bơ̆n hiôk chơt yua kơ bơ̆n băt chang gô măng năr Sư wă ăn kơ bơ̆n oei hơdai hăm Sư hiôk-hian ning-mônh.

English: And not only that, but we also glory in tribulations, knowing that tribulation produces perseverance
Bahnar: Mă bơ̆n đei tơdrong gleh pơmat-tat bơ̆n kư̆m hiôk chơt, yua kơ tơdrong pơmat-tat noh wă hơmet tơdrong lui bơ̆n kơjăp khŏm khŏm.

English: and perseverance, character; and character, hope.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơ̆n adrin tơpă tơdrong lui, lei tơdrong lui bơ̆n rai kơjăp. Tơdrong lui noh ăn kơ bơ̆n chang gô khŏm khŏm.

English: Now hope does not disappoint, because the love of God has been poured out in our hearts by the Holy Spirit who was given to us.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n băt kơ tơdrong bơ̆n chang gô noh ưh kơ jor ôh, yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ bơ̆n Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng Sư, na Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng Sư ăn kơ bơ̆n băt 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm kơ bơ̆n tơpă.

English: For when we were still without strength, in due time Christ died for the ungodly.
Bahnar: Sơ̆ bơ̆n ưh kơ băt tơgŭm akâu bơ̆n pơm 'lơ̆ng thoi yơ, na mưh trŏ kơ năr 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă na đei Yêsu Krist lôch tang bơ̆n bơngai yoch.

English: For scarcely for a righteous man will one die; yet perhaps for a good man someone would even dare to die.
Bahnar: Mă-lei dah kon bơngai bơ̆n, bơ̆n băt kơ buăl bơ̆n ưh kơ đei pơm yoch kiơ ră, mă-lei đe wă phak pơlôch sư, bơ̆n hui bơngai tơpă wă lôch tang buăl bơ̆n.

English: But God demonstrates His own love toward us, in that while we were still sinners, Christ died for us.
Bahnar: Na kơplah bơ̆n oei pơm yoch, lăp minh 'nu Yêsu Krist đĕch lôch tang bơ̆n. 'Noh boih bơ̆n băt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm kơ kon bơngai bơ̆n tơpă.

English: Much more then, having now been justified by His blood, we shall be saved from wrath through Him.
Bahnar: Na dang ei 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ bơ̆n jing bơngai 'lơ̆ng boih yua kơ đei Yêsu Krist lôch tang bơ̆n. 'Noh bơ̆n băt kơ Sư dŏng pơklaih bơ̆n đơ̆ng tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă phak.

English: For if when we were enemies we were reconciled to God through the death of His Son, much more, having been reconciled, we shall be saved by His life.
Bahnar: Kơplah bơ̆n kuă kơ lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, đei Kon Sư Yêsu Krist lôch tang bơ̆n, ăn kơ bơ̆n jing hiôk 'lơ̆ng hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei. Dang ei bơ̆n lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei boih na Sư pơklaih lu bơ̆n tơpă, yua kơ Yêsu Krist iung arih đơ̆ng lôch boih.

English: And not only that, but we also rejoice in God through our Lord Jesus Christ, through whom we have now received the reconciliation.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na dang ei bơ̆n chơt hiôk hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei boih, yua kơ Yêsu pơm 'long sơlam kơ bơ̆n hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei; yua kơ Yêsu na bơ̆n gơh hiôk hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Therefore, just as through one man sin entered the world, and death through sin, and thus death spread to all men, because all sinned
Bahnar: Yua kơ minh 'nu bơngai đĕch, đĭ-đăng bơngai jing yoch. Yua kơ đơ̆ng sư pơm yoch na sư lôch. Thoi noh đĭ-đăng kon bơngai gô lôch ngăl yua kơ đĭ-đăng kon bơngai pơm yoch ngăl boih.

English: (For until the law sin was in the world, but sin is not imputed when there is no law.
Bahnar: Hơdrol kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei athei Môis chih tơdrong juăt Sư pơkă sơ̆, kon bơngai đĭ hlôi pơm yoch boih, mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei huay kơ jô̆ yo ôh, yua kơ Sư tam mă ăn kơ bơ̆n tơdrong juăt Sư pơkă noh.

English: Nevertheless death reigned from Adam to Moses, even over those who had not sinned according to the likeness of the transgression of Adam, who is a type of Him who was to come.
Bahnar: Iŏk đơ̆ng chăl arih 'bok Ađam truh tơ chăl arih Môis kon bơngai kư̆m đei lôch. 'Bok Ađam yoch yua kơ sư ưh kơ chu kơ nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă, na kơplah noh sơ̆ lu bơngai mă ưh kơ pơm yoch thoi sư kư̆m wang lôch thoi sư mơ̆n. 'Bok Ađam pơm kơ bơ̆n tơm, noh wă pơtih gia kơ Yêsu wă truh đơ̆ng rŏng, kư̆m pơm tơm kơ bơ̆n mơ̆n.

English: But the free gift is not like the offense. For if by the one man’s offense many died, much more the grace of God and the gift by the grace of the one Man, Jesus Christ, abounded to many.
Bahnar: Tơdrong yoch hăm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm mơnat, sư phara. Tơdrong yoch, yua kơ minh 'nu bơngai pơm yoch na đĭ-đăng bơngai jing lôch. Na tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm mơnat, yua kơ minh 'nu Yêsu Krist lôch tang đĭ-đăng kon bơngai na kon bơngai gô iung arih.

English: And the gift is not like that which came through the one who sinned. For the judgment which came from one offense resulted in condemnation, but the free gift which came from many offenses resulted in justification.
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm mơnat sư phara kơ tơdrong yoch. Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ minh 'nu pơm yoch sơ̆ 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ kon bơngai bơ̆n yoch hloi. Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh kon bơngai pơm yoch rai dêh, 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm kơ bơ̆n rai dêh, truh tơ Sư mah ăn Kon pôm Sư lôch tang kon bơngai, đơ̆ng noh na Sư jô̆ kon bơngai jing 'lơ̆ng dơ̆ng boih.

English: For if by the one man’s offense death reigned through the one, much more those who receive abundance of grace and of the gift of righteousness will reign in life through the One, Jesus Christ.)
Bahnar: Sơ̆ yua kơ minh 'nu bơngai pơm yoch, na kon bơngai lôch ngăl, mă-lei dang ei bơ̆n đei minh 'nu bơngai nai anăn Sư Yêsu Krist, Sư dŏng bơ̆n tơpă. Bu gơnang kơ Sư, 'Bok Kei-Dei mơnat kơ bơngai noh, jô̆ bơngai noh jing bơngai 'lơ̆ng boih, na Yêsu ăn kơ sư noh arih hiôk-hian ling-lang.

English: Therefore, as through one man’s offense judgment came to all men, resulting in condemnation, even so through one Man’s righteous act the free gift came to all men, resulting in justification of life.
Bahnar: Yua kơ minh 'nu bơngai yoch na 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ đĭ-đăng bơngai yoch; na dang ei kư̆m lei-lăi thoi noh mơ̆n, đei minh 'nu bơngai pơm 'lơ̆ng boih na 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ đĭ-đăng kon bơngai bơ̆n jing bơngai rơngei wă kơ bơ̆n arih ling-lang.

English: For as by one man’s disobedience many were made sinners, so also by one Man’s obedience many will be made righteous.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ đĭ-đăng bơngai yoch yua kơ đơ̆ng minh 'nu 'bok Ađam sơ̆, sư ưh kơ chu kơ nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei. Dang ei 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ đei lơ bơngai 'lơ̆ng, yua kơ đơ̆ng Yêsu Krist Sư chu kơ nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Moreover the law entered that the offense might abound. But where sin abounded, grace abounded much more
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă kơ bơ̆n tơdrong juăt Sư sơ̆, Sư wă tơbăt kơ bơ̆n đei tơdrong yoch tih; Sư 'bôh bơ̆n đei tơdrong yoch tih na Sư 'mêm kơ bơ̆n rai dêh.

English: so that as sin reigned in death, even so grace might reign through righteousness to eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.
Bahnar: Tơdrong yoch pơm kơ kon bơngai jing lôch, mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư 'mêm na jô̆ bơ̆n jing bơngai 'lơ̆ng, ăn kơ bơ̆n arih ling-lang yua kơ Kră Yang bơ̆n Yêsu Krist.

English: What shall we say then? Shall we continue in sin that grace may abound?
Bahnar: Bơ̆n đei tơdrong yoch tih, mă-lei đei 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm kơ bơ̆n rai dêh. Mă-lei bơ̆n 'nĕ tơchĕng khan, lê̆ bơ̆n pơm yoch khŏm khŏm kư̆m bưh wă kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm kơ bơ̆n rai hloh kơ noh, ưh ôh hŏ.

English: Certainly not! How shall we who died to sin live any longer in it?
Bahnar: Yua kơ bơ̆n bơngai dang lĕ kơ lôch boih, liơ gơh pơm yoch dơ̆ng?

English: Or do you not know that as many of us as were baptized into Christ Jesus were baptized into His death?
Bahnar: Kơplah bơ̆n iŏk 'batem sơ̆ rim 'nu kơ bơ̆n tơmơ̆t lăm Yêsu Krist dang lĕ kơ bơ̆n lôch păng Sư boih.

English: Therefore we were buried with Him through baptism into death, that just as Christ was raised from the dead by the glory of the Father, even so we also should walk in newness of life.
Bahnar: Đe pơm 'batem kơ bơ̆n tơmôch bơ̆n lăm đak, noh dang đe 'bŭ bơ̆n minh pôm bong hăm Sư boih. Na 'Bok Kei-Dei yua mơsêh mơyang Sư tơiung arih Yêsu Krist đơ̆ng lôch, noh wă khan bơ̆n đei tơdrong arih 'nao ưh pă kiơ̆ tơdrong so dơ̆ng.

English: For if we have been united together in the likeness of His death, certainly we also shall be in the likeness of His resurrection
Bahnar: Yua kơ bơ̆n dang lôch hơdai păng Yêsu na 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn bơ̆n arih 'nao ahrei âu, thoi ăn kơ Yêsu iung arih sơ̆ mơ̆n.

English: knowing this, that our old man was crucified with Him, that the body of sin might be done away with, that we should no longer be slaves of sin.
Bahnar: Sơ̆ bơ̆n akâu so, mă-lei dang ei dang đe pơ̆ng pơlôch bơ̆n hơdai hăm Yêsu tơ 'long pơglang boih, wă tơhiong đĭ dôm tơdrong so na mă bơ̆n gơh rơngei đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch.

English: For he who has died has been freed from sin.
Bahnar: Tơ̆ng bơ̆n lôch, bơ̆n rơngei boih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch.

English: Now if we died with Christ, we believe that we shall also live with Him
Bahnar: Yua kơ bơ̆n dang lôch hơdai hăm Yêsu boih, na bơ̆n băt tơpă bơ̆n gô arih 'nao kiơ̆ thoi Sư mơ̆n, ưh pă layơ wă iŏk tơdrong so dơ̆ng.

English: knowing that Christ, having been raised from the dead, dies no more. Death no longer has dominion over Him.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n băt 'Bok Kei-Dei tơiung arih Yêsu đơ̆ng lôch, Yêsu ưh pă layơ wă lôch dơ̆ng, Sư rơngei đơ̆ng tơdrong lôch boih.

English: For the death that He died, He died to sin once for all; but the life that He lives, He lives to God.
Bahnar: Yêsu lôch sơ̆ Sư hŭt đĭ dôm tơdrong yoch bơ̆n hloi; dang ei Sư arih, Sư jang tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Likewise you also, reckon yourselves to be dead indeed to sin, but alive to God in Christ Jesus our Lord.
Bahnar: Akâu bơ̆n kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n, dang bơ̆n lôch hŭt đĭ dôm tơdrong yoch, gơnang kơ Yêsu Krist đei arih 'nao kiơ̆ thoi Sư, na jang tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei lei-lăi.

English: Therefore do not let sin reign in your mortal body, that you should obey it in its lusts.
Bahnar: Akâu bơ̆n juăt kơ pơm yoch, bơ̆n athei gơ̆t 'nĕ pă ăn pơm yoch dơ̆ng. Ning-mônh akâu kon bơngai bơ̆n gô tơ'bơ̆p tơdrong lôch.

English: And do not present your members as instruments of unrighteousness to sin, but present yourselves to God as being alive from the dead, and your members as instruments of righteousness to God.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n 'nĕ pă ăn akâu bơ̆n pơm yoch, bơ̆n athei pơjao akâu bơ̆n kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch, wă kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wei-lăng chăl arih bơ̆n tơpăt ling-lang dang bơ̆n iung arih đơ̆ng lôch.

English: For sin shall not have dominion over you, for you are not under law but under grace.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu oei gơnang kơ akâu sư kơdih kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă ưh kơ kĕ ôh, lei bơngai 'noh sư oei pơm yoch hơnơ̆ng; bơ̆n athei gơnang kơ tơdrong Yêsu lôch tang bơ̆n păng tơgŭm bơ̆n, na bơ̆n huay pă pơm yoch.

English: What then? Shall we sin because we are not under law but under grace? Certainly not!
Bahnar: Dah bơ̆n ưh pă gơnang kơ akâu bơ̆n kơdih wă kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă, lei bơ̆n hơđơ̆ng tơpă, bơ̆n gô mơ̆ng kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm bơ̆n. Mă-lei bơ̆n 'nĕ tơchĕng khan dah bơ̆n ưh pă gơnang kơ akâu bơ̆n kơdih wă kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă, khan bơ̆n gơh pơm yoch. Ưh ôh.

English: Do you not know that to whom you present yourselves slaves to obey, you are that one’s slaves whom you obey, whether of sin leading to death, or of obedience leading to righteousness?
Bahnar: Iĕm băt mơ̆n, tơ̆ng bơ̆n đĭch đe, bơ̆n athei chu kơ yŏng tơ'ngla. Tơ̆ng bơ̆n đĭch gah tơdrong yoch, bơ̆n gô 'bôh tơdrong lôch. Tơ̆ng bơ̆n đĭch 'Bok Kei-Dei, bơ̆n athei chu kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, bơ̆n gô 'bôh tơdrong bơ̆n chu jing bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: But God be thanked that though you were slaves of sin, yet you obeyed from the heart that form of doctrine to which you were delivered.
Bahnar: Sơ̆ iĕm đĭch gah tơdrong yoch ră, mă-lei bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơklaih iĕm rơngei boih yua kơ iĕm lui kơ tơdrong đe bơtho hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m klơm klak.

English: And having been set free from sin, you became slaves of righteousness.
Bahnar: Dang ei iĕm klaih rơngei đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch boih, iĕm jing đĭch 'Bok Kei-Dei dơ̆ng wă pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: I speak in human terms because of the weakness of your flesh. For just as you presented your members as slaves of uncleanness, and of lawlessness leading to more lawlessness, so now present your members as slaves of righteousness for holiness.
Bahnar: Tơdrong pơm đĭch noh ưh kơ sĭ iĕm jing đĭch tơpă ôh, inh pơtih gia wă kơ iĕm hlôh đĕch. Yua kơ sơ̆ iĕm dang pơjao akâu iĕm pơm kơnê̆ kư̆ kă khŏm khŏm rai tih, na dang ei iĕm pơjao akâu iĕm kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt thoi Sư boih.

English: For when you were slaves of sin, you were free in regard to righteousness.
Bahnar: Kơplah iĕm oei đĭch tơdrong yoch sơ̆, iĕm ưh kơ wă pơm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơdrong tơpăt ôh.

English: What fruit did you have then in the things of which you are now ashamed? For the end of those things is death.
Bahnar: Tơdrong iĕm pơm yoch sơ̆ ưh kơ đei tơgŭm iĕm minh tơdrong kiơ ôh. Dang ei iĕm băt mơlâu kơ tơdrong yoch iĕm sơ̆ boih; tơdrong bơ̆n pơm yoch bơ̆n gô lôch hiong đĕch.

English: But now having been set free from sin, and having become slaves of God, you have your fruit to holiness, and the end, everlasting life.
Bahnar: Mă-lei dang ei iĕm rơngei boih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch, jing đĭch 'Bok Kei-Dei. Iĕm đĭch dang ei noh pơyua iĕm jing bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt gơh arih ling-lang.

English: For the wages of sin is death, but the gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord.
Bahnar: Bu jang chă tơdrong yoch, apah sư tơdrong lôch. Mă-lei gah lu bơ̆n, dang ei 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn đĕch kơ bơ̆n arih ling-lang yua kơ bơ̆n lui kơ Kră Yang bơ̆n Yêsu Krist.

English: Or do you not know, brethren (for I speak to those who know the law), that the law has dominion over a man as long as he lives?
Bahnar: Ơ lu 'nhŏng oh, iĕm kư̆m băt boih gah tơdrong pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt, kon bơngai bơ̆n pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt kơplah bơ̆n oei arih đĕch, mưh lôch boih bơ̆n ưh pă gơh kiơ̆ dơ̆ng.

English: For the woman who has a husband is bound by the law to her husband as long as he lives. But if the husband dies, she is released from the law of her husband.
Bahnar: Na kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt bơ̆n hmă khan, dah bơngai drŏ-kăn đei klo, sư athei oei kơ klo sư truh tơ klo sư lôch, sư ưh pă tơchĕng kơ tơdrong juăt hli kơ pơm yoch kơ klo sư dơ̆ng boih.

English: So then if, while her husband lives, she marries another man, she will be called an adulteress; but if her husband dies, she is free from that law, so that she is no adulteress, though she has married another man.
Bahnar: Na dah klo sư oei arih, akăn sư iŏk klo nai, sư noh kơđang kơ̆l ako 'brơh kơ klo sư. Mă-lei dah klo sư lôch boih, sư ưh pă hli kơ tơdrong juăt dơ̆ng boih păng mă sư iŏk klo nai đe kư̆m huay pă jô̆ kơ sư pơm yoch boih.

English: Therefore, my brethren, you also have become dead to the law through the body of Christ, that you may be married to another—to Him who was raised from the dead, that we should bear fruit to God.
Bahnar: Ơ 'nhŏng oh, tơdrong noh wă pơtih gia kơ bơ̆n dang bơ̆n lôch kiơ̆ Yêsu tơ 'long pơglang sơ̆ boih, na bơ̆n huay pă wă gơnang kơ akâu bơ̆n kơdih wă kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă dơ̆ng ôh. Yua kơ dang bơ̆n iŏk bơngai nai boih, wă khan bơ̆n iŏk Yêsu Krist mă 'Bok Kei-Dei tơiung arih đơ̆ng lôch. Dang ei bơ̆n jang tơdrong Sư dang bơ̆n pơyua 'Bok Kei-Dei boih.

English: For when we were in the flesh, the sinful passions which were aroused by the law were at work in our members to bear fruit to death.
Bahnar: Hơdrol sơ̆ bơ̆n oei kiơ̆ kơ akâu bơ̆n kơdih, na 'maih pơm tôm tơdrong yoch. Bơ̆n băt kơ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă noh khă kuă ăn bơ̆n pơm yoch ră, mă-lei bơ̆n oei pơm yoch rai dêh khŏm khŏm truh tơ lôch.

English: But now we have been delivered from the law, having died to what we were held by, so that we should serve in the newness of the Spirit and not in the oldness of the letter.
Bahnar: Mă-lei dang ei bơ̆n dang lôch kiơ̆ Yêsu Krist na bơ̆n ưh pă kăl gơnang kơ akâu bơ̆n kơdih wă kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă sơ̆. Yua kơ thoi noh na bơ̆n athei lui yom kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, ưh pă gơnang akâu kơdih wă kiơ̆ tơdrong so mă Môis chih pơkă sơ̆, bơ̆n kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong arih 'nao đơ̆ng Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng ăn.

English: What shall we say then? Is the law sin? Certainly not! On the contrary, I would not have known sin except through the law. For I would not have known covetousness unless the law had said, “You shall not covet.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei iĕm 'nĕ tơchĕng khan inh jô̆ kơ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng, ưh ôh hŏ. Tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă 'lơ̆ng tơpă. Sư tơbăt ăn kơ bơ̆n đei tơdrong yoch. Tơ̆ng bơ̆n ưh kơ đei tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă, lei bơ̆n ưh kơ băt bơ̆n đei tơdrong yoch ôh. Pơtih gia kơ akâu inh kơdih thoi âu: Sơ̆ inh ưh kơ băt kơ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei khă kuă ăn bơ̆n 'nhĕng mŭk tơmam đe, mưh 'nhĕng jing yoch tơpă; na inh ưh kơ băt kơ tơdrong 'nhĕng noh yoch.

English: But sin, taking opportunity by the commandment, produced in me all manner of evil desire. For apart from the law sin was dead.
Bahnar: Lăp inh băt, inh 'nhĕng rai dêh, đơ̆ng 'bơ̆t noh boih inh băt kơ inh kơdih pơm yoch. Dah bơ̆n ưh kơ băt kơ tơdrong juăt khă bơ̆n pơm yoch, lei bơ̆n dă 'biơ̆ kơ pơm yoch.

English: I was alive once without the law, but when the commandment came, sin revived and I died.
Bahnar: Sơ̆ kơplah inh tam mă băt kơ tơdrong yoch, inh oei hiôk; lăp đơ̆ng năr inh băt kơ tơdrong pơm yoch, jơhngơ̆m inh ưh pă hiôk boih, inh băt kơ inh trŏ kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă phak pơlôch.

English: And the commandment, which was to bring life, I found to bring death.
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă kơ bơ̆n tơdrong juăt noh sơ̆ wă kơ bơ̆n oei arih hiôk ră, mă-lei tơdrong juăt noh wă ăn kơ inh lôch.

English: For sin, taking occasion by the commandment, deceived me, and by it killed me.
Bahnar: Inh ngêh kơ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă noh sơ̆ wă ăn kơ inh arih hiôk, na 'nâu khan rai tơbăt kơ inh bơngai yoch trŏ kơ wă lôch răm. 'Noh yua kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ oei lăm jơhngơ̆m inh pơm kơ inh yoch.

English: Therefore the law is holy, and the commandment holy and just and good.
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong mă 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă, tơdrong 'lơ̆ng, tơdrong trŏ tơpă.

English: Has then what is good become death to me? Certainly not! But sin, that it might appear sin, was producing death in me through what is good, so that sin through the commandment might become exceedingly sinful.
Bahnar: Na ưh kơ sĭ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă mă 'lơ̆ng noh pơm kơ inh trŏ kơ wă lôch răm ôh. Tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei tơbăt kơ inh bơngai yoch, mă inh yoch noh yua kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ oei lăm jơhngơ̆m inh, sư pơm kơ inh yoch kơ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă na trŏ kơ lôch răm. Thoi noh bơ̆n băt boih tơdrong kơnê̆ oei lăm jơhngơ̆m bơ̆n kơnê̆ tơpă.

English: For we know that the law is spiritual, but I am carnal, sold under sin.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n băt mơ̆n tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă trŏ tơpă; na kiơ̆ thoi inh bơngai tơrăn ưh kơ kĕ kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt noh, na jing đĭch kơ tơdrong yoch inh tơpă.

English: For what I am doing, I do not understand. For what I will to do, that I do not practice; but what I hate, that I do.
Bahnar: Na inh đĭ pă hiôk boih, đon hơdơ̆r 'bơ̆r apơi wă kơ pơm 'lơ̆ng ngăl ră, mă-lei ưh kơ pơm; kuă kơ pơm yoch ră mă-lei oei pơm.

English: If, then, I do what I will not to do, I agree with the law that it is good.
Bahnar: Inh băt dôm tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă trŏ tơpă, rŏ kuă kơ pơm yoch mă-lei oei pơm.

English: But now, it is no longer I who do it, but sin that dwells in me.
Bahnar: 'Noh ưh kơ sĭ inh wă pơm yoch ôh, inh pơm yoch yua kơ đei tơdrong kơnê̆ oei lăm jơhngơ̆m, pơm kơ inh yoch.

English: For I know that in me (that is, in my flesh) nothing good dwells; for to will is present with me, but how to perform what is good I do not find.
Bahnar: Na dang ei inh băt boih tơdrong 'lơ̆ng hoh-hoy kơ oei lăm inh hơya tŏ sĕt, tă ling kơnê̆ ngăl. Kiơ̆ kơ đon hơdơ̆r 'bơ̆r apơi wă kơ pơm 'lơ̆ng ngăl ră, mă-lei ưh kơ kĕ.

English: For the good that I will to do, I do not do; but the evil I will not to do, that I practice.
Bahnar: Rŏ kơ kĕ, mă-lei oei ưh.

English: Now if I do what I will not to do, it is no longer I who do it, but sin that dwells in me.
Bahnar: Kuă ră, oei pơm, noh inh băt tơpă ưh kơ sĭ inh pơrơ̆ng ôh, yua kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ oei lăm jơhngơ̆m inh tih dêh, na inh oei pơm oei pơm.

English: I find then a law, that evil is present with me, the one who wills to do good.
Bahnar: Tơdrong pơm 'lơ̆ng, inh tôch adrin adran ră boih, oei ưh kơ kĕ 'mơ̆i, chu pơm yoch hơnơ̆ng.

English: For I delight in the law of God according to the inward man.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m klơm klak inh 'maih kiơ̆ tôm tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă ră.

English: But I see another law in my members, warring against the law of my mind, and bringing me into captivity to the law of sin which is in my members.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdrong kơnê̆ lăm akâu inh pơgăn, tơdrong kơnê̆ noh rôp pơgŏ inh, wă kơ inh pơm yoch.

English: O wretched man that I am! Who will deliver me from this body of death?
Bahnar: Na inh âu boih bơngai ưh kơ yua tơpă, tơdrong kơnê̆ 'bĕnh kơ akâu ling-lang, na inh wă lôch đĕch boih. Dang ei bu gơh dŏng inh âu?

English: I thank God—through Jesus Christ our Lord! So then, with the mind I myself serve the law of God, but with the flesh the law of sin.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m klơm klak inh 'maih kiơ̆ tôm tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă ră, mă-lei ưh kơ kĕ, đĭ jing đĭch tơdrong kơnê̆. Na dang ei inh bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei mơnat kơ inh, đơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆ 'noh pơklaih ăn kơ inh rơngei boih. Păng inh bơnê kơ Kră Yang Yêsu Krist kư̆m tơgŭm inh mơ̆n.

English: There is therefore now no condemnation to those who are in Christ Jesus, who do not walk according to the flesh, but according to the Spirit.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh na dôm lu bơ̆n bơngai mă lui kơ Yêsu Krist, 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh pă wă phak lu bơ̆n dơ̆ng boih.

English: For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus has made me free from the law of sin and death.
Bahnar: Yua kơ bơ̆n lui kơ Yêsu Krist, na Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng ăn kơ bơ̆n tơdrong arih 'nao, bơ̆n jing klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch, ưh pă hli kơ lôch dơ̆ng.

English: For what the law could not do in that it was weak through the flesh, God did by sending His own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh, on account of sin: He condemned sin in the flesh
Bahnar: Tơ̆ng bơ̆n oei gơnang kơ akâu bơ̆n kơdih wă kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă sơ̆, bơ̆n ưh kơ gơh klaih rơngei păng ưh kơ gơh pơm 'lơ̆ng hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei ôh yua kơ akâu kon bơngai bơ̆n ưh kơ kĕ ĕnh kơ tơdrong pơm yoch. Yua kơ thoi noh na 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư wă tơgŭm bơ̆n, Sư tơgŭm tơpă. Sư wơh Kon pôm Sư jur jing thoi kon bơngai bơ̆n, Kon Sư noh pơklaih bơ̆n đơ̆ng dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ ngăl pơm kơ bơ̆n yoch, na dang ei bơ̆n ưh pă hli kơ yoch dơ̆ng, yua kơ jei Yêsu boih.

English: that the righteous requirement of the law might be fulfilled in us who do not walk according to the flesh but according to the Spirit.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm thoi noh, Sư wă kơ bơ̆n huay kơ gơnang kơ akâu bơ̆n kơdih, athei gơnang kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng đĕch, na bơ̆n kĕ pơm kiơ̆ dôm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă.

English: For those who live according to the flesh set their minds on the things of the flesh, but those who live according to the Spirit, the things of the Spirit.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă gơnang kơ akâu sư kơdih, lu sư adrin adran hăm akâu sư kơdih. Lu bơngai gơnang kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng, lu sư gô mơ̆ng kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng.

English: For to be carnally minded is death, but to be spiritually minded is life and peace.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu gơnang kơ akâu sư kơdih, bơngai noh mưh sư lôch năm tơ anih 'Bok Kei-Dei phak. Bơngai bu gơnang kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng, sư gô arih hiôk-hian ling-lang.

English: Because the carnal mind is enmity against God; for it is not subject to the law of God, nor indeed can be.
Bahnar: Bơngai mă gơnang kơ akâu sư kơdih, sư ayăt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, sư ưh kơ 'maih kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă; mă tơ̆ng sư 'maih, sư kư̆m ưh kơ kĕ kiơ̆ ôh.

English: So then, those who are in the flesh cannot please God.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu gơnang kơ akâu sư kơdih, bơngai noh sư ưh kơ gơh pơm kiơ̆ thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei wă.

English: But you are not in the flesh but in the Spirit, if indeed the Spirit of God dwells in you. Now if anyone does not have the Spirit of Christ, he is not His.
Bahnar: Mă-lei gah iĕm, iĕm ưh kơ gơnang kơ akâu iĕm kơdih ôh, iĕm gơnang kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng, yua kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei oei hăm iĕm. Yua kơ Yêsu Krist ăn noh, Sư ăn kơ rim 'nu bơngai bu mă lui kơ Sư. Bơngai mă ưh kơ đei Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng, bơngai noh ưh kơ lui kơ Yêsu ôh.

English: And if Christ is in you, the body is dead because of sin, but the Spirit is life because of righteousness.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Yêsu Krist dang ei Sư oei lăm akâu bơ̆n, mă khan akâu bơ̆n lôch. Tơdrong lôch yua kơ đơ̆ng yă 'bok bơ̆n pơm yoch sơ̆. Mă-lei ning-mônh bơ̆n gô đei tơdrong arih ling-lang yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ bơ̆n dang ei bơngai 'lơ̆ng hăm Sư boih.

English: But if the Spirit of Him who raised Jesus from the dead dwells in you, He who raised Christ from the dead will also give life to your mortal bodies through His Spirit who dwells in you.
Bahnar: Sơ̆ 'Bok Kei-Dei yua Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng Sư tơiung arih Yêsu đơ̆ng lôch. Dah Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng oei lăm bơ̆n, lei ning-mônh 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m yua Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng Sư tơiung arih bơ̆n đơ̆ng lôch mơ̆n.

English: Therefore, brethren, we are debtors—not to the flesh, to live according to the flesh.
Bahnar: Ơ 'nhŏng oh, yua kơ thoi noh na bơ̆n athei kiơ̆ tơdrong Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng, 'nĕ pă gơnang kơ akâu bơ̆n kơdih dơ̆ng.

English: For if you live according to the flesh you will die; but if by the Spirit you put to death the deeds of the body, you will live.
Bahnar: Dah bơ̆n oei gơnang kơ akâu bơ̆n kơdih, bơ̆n gô pŭ tơdrong phak. Dah bơ̆n gơnang kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng wă hŭt lê̆ tơdrong bơ̆n kơdih lei ning-mônh bơ̆n gô arih ling-lang.

English: For as many as are led by the Spirit of God, these are sons of God.
Bahnar: Dôm lu bơngai lui yom kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei, lu sư jing kon 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: For you did not receive the spirit of bondage again to fear, but you received the Spirit of adoption by whom we cry out, “Abba, Father.”
Bahnar: Ưh kơ sĭ 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng wă kơ bơ̆n jing bơngai đĭch, dah wă kơ bơ̆n oei hli ôh. Sư ăn kơ bơ̆n Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng wă kơ bơ̆n jing kon Sư. Thoi noh na bơ̆n gơh krao kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei Aba, 'Bă bơ̆n.

English: The Spirit Himself bears witness with our spirit that we are children of God
Bahnar: Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng, Sư oei lăm bơ̆n, Sư tơbăt ăn kơ bơ̆n hlôh gah tơdrong bơ̆n jing kon 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă.

English: and if children, then heirs—heirs of God and joint heirs with Christ, if indeed we suffer with Him, that we may also be glorified together.
Bahnar: Pơtih gia kơ 'bă pơjing bơ̆n tơ ala teh âu, sư đei mŭk tơmam sư 'măn lê̆ kơ bơ̆n yua kơ bơ̆n kon sư. Na 'Bă bơ̆n tơ plĕnh ti Sư kư̆m lei-lăi. Sư ăn kơ bơ̆n tơdrong hiôk 'lơ̆ng yua kơ bơ̆n jing kon Sư, kư̆m thoi Sư ăn kơ Kon Sư Yêsu Krist. Mă tơdrong gleh truh kơ bơ̆n kư̆m bưh, noh kư̆m thoi Yêsu sơ̆, ning-mônh bơ̆n gô oei hơdai hăm Yêsu hiôk dêh.

English: For I consider that the sufferings of this present time are not worthy to be compared with the glory which shall be revealed in us.
Bahnar: Mă bơ̆n đei tơdrong gleh truh pơmat-tat dang ei, mă-lei inh băt tơpă ning-mônh bơ̆n gô oei hơdai hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei hiôk dêh; na mă bơ̆n pơmat-tat, bơ̆n kư̆m pơm hiôk thoi lĕ kơ năr jơhngơ̆m bơ̆n hiôk, yua kơ ning-mônh bơ̆n gô hiôk tơpă.

English: For the earnest expectation of the creation eagerly waits for the revealing of the sons of God.
Bahnar: Bĭ lu tơmam 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing, lu sư kư̆m dang băt chang gô 'Bok Kei-Dei wă ăn kơ bơ̆n jing kon Sư hiôk jơnap ning-mônh.

English: For the creation was subjected to futility, not willingly, but because of Him who subjected it in hope
Bahnar: Sơ̆ 'Bok Kei-Dei lăng dôm tơmam Sư pơjing, Sư lăp đon dêh. Mă-lei dang ei Sư ăn kơ dôm lu tơmam Sư pơjing noh pơmat-tat yua kơ kon bơngai pơm yoch, ưh kơ sĭ yua kơ tơmam noh pơm yoch ôh. Dang ei Sư oei ăn kơ lu tơmam Sư pơjing noh pơmat-tat, ning-mônh Sư ăn hiôk 'lơ̆ng tơpă.

English: because the creation itself also will be delivered from the bondage of corruption into the glorious liberty of the children of God.
Bahnar: Tơpă ning-mônh Sư ăn kơ lu tơmam Sư pơjing noh, ưh pă pơmat lôch răm thoi dang ei dơ̆ng ôh, lu sư jing rơngei hiôk tơpă, kư̆m thoi lu bơ̆n kon 'Bok Kei-Dei mơ̆n.

English: For we know that the whole creation groans and labors with birth pangs together until now.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n băt lu tơmam 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing noh kư̆m hơdai pơmat-tat đơ̆ng sơ̆ khơ̆ dang ei, lu sư dang lĕ kơ bơngai drŏ-kăn jĭ anăp wă tơpŭ.

English: Not only that, but we also who have the firstfruits of the Spirit, even we ourselves groan within ourselves, eagerly waiting for the adoption, the redemption of our body.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ sĭ dôm lu tơmam 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing noh đĕch ôh pơmat-tat. Lu bơ̆n bơngai mă đei Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng kư̆m hang nuih pơmat-tat thoi lu tơmam noh mơ̆n. Na dang ei chang jah truh khei 'năr 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă khan wă ăn kơ bơ̆n jing kon Sư ei đĕch hiôk, wă kơ bơ̆n dah tơplih jing akâu 'nao thoi Yêsu. Bơ̆n băt kơ Sư wă ăn kơ bơ̆n hiôk ning-mônh, yua kơ Sư ăn kơ bơ̆n Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng Sư dang ei.

English: For we were saved in this hope, but hope that is seen is not hope; for why does one still hope for what he sees?
Bahnar: Thoi noh bơ̆n chang gô wă kơ jing kon Sư gơh tơplih jing akâu 'nao ning-mônh. Mă-lei dah tơdrong bơ̆n mă 'bôh boih păng băt boih bơ̆n ưh kơ kăl kơ chang gô ôh.

English: But if we hope for what we do not see, we eagerly wait for it with perseverance.
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdrong tam mă 'bôh na bơ̆n chang gô khŏm khŏm dĭng 'bôh.

English: Likewise the Spirit also helps in our weaknesses. For we do not know what we should pray for as we ought, but the Spirit Himself makes intercession for us with groanings which cannot be uttered.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n kơdih ưh kơ gơh, mă-lei đei Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơgŭm bơ̆n. Bơ̆n ưh kơ băt wă krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi yơ, mă-lei Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng Sư tơgŭm bơ̆n gơh krao khan hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m.

English: Now He who searches the hearts knows what the mind of the Spirit is, because He makes intercession for the saints according to the will of God.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư băt lăm jơhngơ̆m klơm klak bơ̆n tơchĕng thoi yơ, Sư băt kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơgŭm bơ̆n krao khan thoi noh, yua kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơgŭm lu bơngai lui krao khan kiơ̆ thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei wă.

English: And we know that all things work together for good to those who love God, to those who are the called according to His purpose.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n 'bôh bơngai bu mă 'mêm kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, bơngai noh 'Bok Kei-Dei rơih iŏk lui kơ Sư, lu bơngai thoi noh boih, mă sư tơ'bơ̆p tơdrong kiơ, bơ̆n băt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ sư hiôk ngăl.

English: For whom He foreknew, He also predestined to be conformed to the image of His Son, that He might be the firstborn among many brethren.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai thoi noh, hơdrol kơ đe tam mă tơpŭ kơ sư sơ̆, 'Bok Kei-Dei băt kơ lu sư hơdrol boih. Lu bơngai thoi noh 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă wă ăn jing kon Sư thoi Yêsu Krist; Yêsu Krist jing 'Nhŏng Kơdră lu sư, lu sư jing oh Yêsu.

English: Moreover whom He predestined, these He also called; whom He called, these He also justified; and whom He justified, these He also glorified.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai thoi noh 'Bok Kei-Dei rơih iŏk, Sư jô̆ lu bơngai thoi noh bơngai tơpăt hăm Sư. Lu bơngai noh 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ jing kon Sư, gô oei hăm Sư hiôk jơnap.

English: What then shall we say to these things? If God is for us, who can be against us?
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư 'mêm, Sư tơgŭm bơ̆n dang noh boih, na bơ̆n ưh pă hli kơ tơdrong kiơ dơ̆ng.

English: He who did not spare His own Son, but delivered Him up for us all, how shall He not with Him also freely give us all things?
Bahnar: Sư 'mêm kơ bơ̆n tơpă na Sư mah ăn Kon pôm Sư lôch tang kon bơngai. Thoi noh bơ̆n băt Sư wă tơgŭm bơ̆n tôm tơdrong nai hai mơ̆n.

English: Who shall bring a charge against God’s elect? It is God who justifies.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n tơ'ngla 'Bok Kei-Dei rơih iŏk jô̆ bơ̆n jing bơngai 'lơ̆ng hăm Sư boih, thoi yơ đe gơh jô̆ kơ bơ̆n bơngai yoch hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei?

English: Who is he who condemns? It is Christ who died, and furthermore is also risen, who is even at the right hand of God, who also makes intercession for us.
Bahnar: Lăm lu bơ̆n hăm đei đe jô̆ khan bơngai 'Bok Kei-Dei wă phak? Kră Yang Yêsu Krist ưh kơ đei jô̆ thoi noh ôh, na mă Sư gơh lôch tang bơ̆n. Mă-lei Sư iung arih boih, Sư tŏk oei gah 'ma kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, Sư apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm bơ̆n ling-lang.

English: Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? Shall tribulation, or distress, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or peril, or sword?
Bahnar: Mă bơ̆n tơ'bơ̆p tơdrong kiơ kiơ, Yêsu Krist Sư wei-lăng bơ̆n, mă bơ̆n đei tơdrong truh pơmat, mă đe areh kơ bơ̆n, mă bơ̆n pơngot rơwĕt, mă bơ̆n bơngai dơnuh, mă bơ̆n đei tơdrong hli, mă đe năm blah bơ̆n, Yêsu Krist ưh kơ lê̆ bơ̆n ôh, Sư 'mêm kơ bơ̆n tơpă.

English: As it is written: “For Your sake we are killed all day long; We are accounted as sheep for the slaughter.”
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'noh lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei đe chih thoi âu: “Ơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, yua kơ nhôn lui kơ Ih, đe nŏng kơ chă nhôn pă dơh năr wă pơlôch. Đe lăng nhôn thoi lĕ kơ triu đe wă 'buh sa.”

English: Yet in all these things we are more than conquerors through Him who loved us.
Bahnar: Mă tơdrong truh kơ bơ̆n thoi noh, bơ̆n 'nĕ kơ hli, gô jei bơ̆n tơpă yua kơ bơ̆n đei Kră Yang bơ̆n Yêsu, bơ̆n hơđơ̆ng kơ tơdrong Sư 'mêm kơ bơ̆n, hăm Sư tơgŭm bơ̆n lăm tôm tơdrong.

English: For I am persuaded that neither death nor life, nor angels nor principalities nor powers, nor things present nor things to come
Bahnar: Na dang ei inh băt tơpă boih, mă đei tơdrong kiơ kiơ truh kơ bơ̆n, 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư oei 'mêm kơ bơ̆n hơnơ̆ng đĕch, yua kơ bơ̆n băt kơ Kră Yang bơ̆n Yêsu Krist 'mêm kơ bơ̆n tơgŭm bơ̆n lăm tôm tơdrong. Mă bơ̆n lôch, mă bơ̆n oei arih, 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư 'mêm kơ bơ̆n ling-lang tơpă. Na mă linh jang, mă yang kơnê̆, mă yang kiơ wă tơgar iŏk bơ̆n đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm kơ bơ̆n ưh kơ kĕ ôh. Mă tơdrong truh kơ bơ̆n kơnh pơgê, dah layơ Sư ưh kơ lê̆ ôh, Sư wei-lăng lu bơ̆n tơpă.

English: nor height nor depth, nor any other created thing, shall be able to separate us from the love of God which is in Christ Jesus our Lord.
Bahnar: Mă 'bok kiơ tơ kơpal plĕnh, dah tơ ala teh âu, mă hăm tơdrong kiơ kiơ wă pơrơ̆ng tơgar iŏk bơ̆n đơ̆ng tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm, lu noh ưh kơ kĕ 'mơ̆i.

English: I tell the truth in Christ, I am not lying, my conscience also bearing me witness in the Holy Spirit
Bahnar: Inh wă roi kơ iĕm gah tơdrong 'nhŏng oh inh khŭl Isơrael. Inh sơ'ngon dêh yua kơ lu sư ưh kơ lui kơ Yêsu. Inh roi kơ iĕm tơdrong 'nâu inh roi tơpă, inh bơngai kiơ̆ Yêsu Krist ưh kơ anul ôh. Yua kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng oei lăm inh, thoi yơ inh gơh anul?

English: that I have great sorrow and continual grief in my heart.
Bahnar: Inh wă roi kơ iĕm gah tơdrong 'nhŏng oh inh khŭl Isơrael. Inh sơ'ngon dêh yua kơ lu sư ưh kơ lui kơ Yêsu. Inh roi kơ iĕm tơdrong 'nâu inh roi tơpă, inh bơngai kiơ̆ Yêsu Krist ưh kơ anul ôh. Yua kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng oei lăm inh, thoi yơ inh gơh anul?

English: For I could wish that I myself were accursed from Christ for my brethren, my countrymen according to the flesh
Bahnar: Inh 'mêm ră kơ lu bơngai Isơrael tă kơ 'nhŏng oh inh ngăl. Đon inh hơdơ̆r kơ lu sư lui kơ Yêsu Krist đĭ, lê̆ kơ inh ưh, pŭ dôm tơdrong phak lu sư ning-mônh.

English: who are Israelites, to whom pertain the adoption, the glory, the covenants, the giving of the law, the service of God, and the promises
Bahnar: Lu sư boih đe anăn bơngai Isơrael, lu sư boih 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ khan kon Sư; 'Bok Kei-Dei oei hơdai hăm lu sư, pơkă khan wă tơgŭm lu sư. 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă kơ lu sư tơdrong juăt wă kơ lu sư kiơ̆ păng bơtho lu sư soi sơmah kơkuh kiơ̆ trŏ thoi Sư wă.

English: of whom are the fathers and from whom, according to the flesh, Christ came, who is over all, the eternally blessed God. Amen.
Bahnar: Lu yă 'bok lu sư sơ̆ lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei hơdrol kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai nai. Na 'Bok Krist mă 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh dŏng pơklaih kon bơngai Sư kư̆m bơngai Isơrael mơ̆n tơ̆ng kiơ̆ kơ mĕ Sư tơpŭ. 'Bok Krist boih Yang tih hloh gơh pơgơ̆r tôm tơdrong, trŏ kơ kon bơngai ư-ang kơ Sư ling-lang tơpă. A-men.

English: But it is not that the word of God has taken no effect. For they are not all Israel who are of Israel
Bahnar: Ưh kơ sĭ 'Bok Kei-Dei kuă kơ tơgŭm lu bơngai Isơrael kiơ̆ thoi Sư pơkă sơ̆ ôh; Sư wă tơgŭm mơ̆n, mă ưh kơ tơgŭm đĭ-đăng hăm lu bơngai ưh kơ lui hai ôh. Sư tơgŭm pôm lu bơngai lui kơ Sư đĕch, lu bơngai Isơrael thoi noh 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm păng lăng dang kon Sư kơdih.

English: nor are they all children because they are the seed of Abraham; but, “In Isaac your seed shall be called.”
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ jô̆ đĭ-đăng lu kon sâu Abraham khan kon sâu Abraham ngăl ôh. Yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei khan kơ Abraham sơ̆ thoi âu: “Lu kon sâu ih mă lĕch đơ̆ng kon ih Isăk noh Inh jô̆ khan kon sâu ih.”

English: That is, those who are the children of the flesh, these are not the children of God; but the children of the promise are counted as the seed.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh na bơ̆n băt đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael ưh kơ jing kon 'Bok Kei-Dei ngăl ôh, pôm lu bơngai mă lĕch đơ̆ng adrĕch 'Bok Kei-Dei anăn đĕch jing kon 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: For this is the word of promise: “At this time I will come and Sarah shall have a son.”
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei khan kơ Abraham sơ̆ thoi âu: “Gô pă minh sơnăm đơ̆ng âu dơ̆ng inh wă ăn kơ biĕm Sara tơpŭ minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo.”

English: And not only this, but when Rebecca also had conceived by one man, even by our father Isaac
Bahnar: Tơpă, đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh na bre sư đei minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo anăn sư Isăk. Isăk noh boih 'bok kơdră lu bơ̆n sơ̆. Akăn Isăk anăn sư yă Rê'bêka, sư tơpŭ 'bar 'nu kon drŏ-nglo kơmar.

English: (for the children not yet being born, nor having done any good or evil, that the purpose of God according to election might stand, not of works but of Him who calls)
Bahnar: Kơplah yă Rê'bêka tam mă tơpŭ kơ bre noh sơ̆, 'Bok Kei-Dei khan lê̆ kơ yă bơ̆n noh sơ̆ thoi âu: “Ning-mônh ih gô tơpŭ 'bar 'nu kon drŏ-nglo kơmar. 'Nhŏng sư gô pơm iĕ kơ oh sư.” 'Bok Kei-Dei khan thoi noh, ưh kơ sĭ yua kơ bre 'nhŏng oh pơm 'lơ̆ng pơm kơnê̆ ôh. Kơplah noh bre ei, mĕ bre sư ưh tam mă tơpŭ ôh. 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă lê̆ hơdrol pơrơ̆ng wă rơih iŏk oh sư pơm tih kơ 'nhŏng sư.

English: it was said to her, “The older shall serve the younger.”
Bahnar: Kơplah yă Rê'bêka tam mă tơpŭ kơ bre noh sơ̆, 'Bok Kei-Dei khan lê̆ kơ yă bơ̆n noh sơ̆ thoi âu: “Ning-mônh ih gô tơpŭ 'bar 'nu kon drŏ-nglo kơmar. 'Nhŏng sư gô pơm iĕ kơ oh sư.” 'Bok Kei-Dei khan thoi noh, ưh kơ sĭ yua kơ bre 'nhŏng oh pơm 'lơ̆ng pơm kơnê̆ ôh. Kơplah noh bre ei, mĕ bre sư ưh tam mă tơpŭ ôh. 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă lê̆ hơdrol pơrơ̆ng wă rơih iŏk oh sư pơm tih kơ 'nhŏng sư.

English: As it is written, “Jacob I have loved, but Esau I have hated.”
Bahnar: Na tơdrong bre noh, lăm hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei roi thoi âu: “Inh 'mêm kơ oh sư Jakôp; gah 'nhŏng sư Êsâu Inh ưh kơ 'mêm ôh.”

English: What shall we say then? Is there unrighteousness with God? Certainly not!
Bahnar: Bơ̆n 'bôh 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ 'mêm kơ bre noh dang ăi, mă-lei bơ̆n 'nĕ tơchĕng khan 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ tơpăt.

English: For He says to Moses, “I will have mercy on whomever I will have mercy, and I will have compassion on whomever I will have compassion.”
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh bơ̆n gô mơ̆ng kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch, yua kơ sơ̆ 'Bok Kei-Dei khan kơ Môis thoi âu: “Inh 'mêm kơ bu gô mơ̆ng kơ Inh wă 'mêm đĕch.”

English: So then it is not of him who wills, nor of him who runs, but of God who shows mercy.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na dang ei bơ̆n băt nhên boih gah tơdrong noh, ưh kơ sĭ đơ̆ng bơ̆n wă kơ Sư 'mêm, dah bơ̆n pơlung Sư wă kơ Sư 'mêm kơ bơ̆n ôh. Sư 'mêm kơ bơ̆n yua kơ Sư wă 'mêm kơdih đĕch.

English: For the Scripture says to the Pharaoh, “For this very purpose I have raised you up, that I may show My power in you, and that My name may be declared in all the earth.”
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh thoi lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma kơ 'bok Pharôn pơtao đe Êyiptơ sơ̆ thoi âu: “Inh ăn kơ ih pơm pơtao arăng kơ̆l tôm tơdrong ưh kơ chu kơ Inh. Na mơsêh mơyang Inh blah ih, wă kơ kon bơngai ư-ang Inh jơ̆p kơ teh đak.”

English: Therefore He has mercy on whom He wills, and whom He wills He hardens.
Bahnar: 'Noh bơ̆n băt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư wă 'mêm kơ bu gô mơ̆ng kơ Sư wă đĕch. Na tơdrong Sư wă ăn kơ đe arăng kơ̆l kư̆m lei-lăi, gô mơ̆ng kơ Sư wă.

English: You will say to me then, “Why does He still find fault? For who has resisted His will?”
Bahnar: Hli kơ iĕm khan: “Yua kơ kiơ 'Bok Kei-Dei oei jô̆ yo kơ bơngai mă Sư ăn arăng kơ̆l, mă bơngai bơ̆n khan kơ Sư, Sư kư̆m ưh kơ chu?”

English: But indeed, O man, who are you to reply against God? Will the thing formed say to him who formed it, “Why have you made me like this?”
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, tơdrong noh tơdrong jang 'Bok Kei-Dei, bơ̆n ưh kơ gơh pơma tơwih kơ Sư ôh. Pơtih gia bơngai man gŏ ge, sư kư̆ kơ man gô mơ̆ng kơ sư wă. Lu gŏ ge mă sư man ưh kơ trŏ kơ pơma tơwih kơ sư khan: “Man kiơ kơ inh kơnê̆ thoi âu?”

English: Does not the potter have power over the clay, from the same lump to make one vessel for honor and another for dishonor?
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ kơ bơngai man gŏ ge gô mơ̆ng kơ sư wă man? Sư kư̆ kơ iŏk teh lơ̆n man khŭl gŏ ge 'lơ̆ng kư̆m đei, man gŏ ge kư̆ kă wă kơ gơh mong sa đĕch kư̆m đei.

English: What if God, wanting to show His wrath and to make His power known, endured with much longsuffering the vessels of wrath prepared for destruction
