Bahnar: Na 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư kư̆m pơm gô mơ̆ng kơ Sư wă. Tơ̆ng kiơ̆ kơ Sư ơh, athei phak lu bơngai kơnê̆ dang ei trŏ, wă kơ kon bơngai jơ̆p kơ teh đak ư-ang kơ Sư Yang mơsêh pran kơtang. Mă-lei dang ei 'Bok Kei-Dei oei ĕnh kơ tơdrong phak noh.

English: and that He might make known the riches of His glory on the vessels of mercy, which He had prepared beforehand for glory
Bahnar: Yua kơ Sư oei gô lu bơngai mă Sư 'mêm. Sư wă hơmet jơhngơ̆m lu bơngai mă Sư 'mêm noh hơdrol 'mơ̆i, wă kơ lu bơngai noh gơh oei hơdai hăm Sư ning-mônh. Lu bơngai noh 'Bok Kei-Dei rơih iŏk đơ̆ng blŭng-a sơ̆ hloi boih, noh na Sư oei gô.

English: even us whom He called, not of the Jews only, but also of the Gentiles?
Bahnar: Lu bơngai noh wă khan lu bơ̆n âu boih Sư rơih iŏk. Ưh kơ sĭ Sư rơih iŏk pôm lu bơngai Isơrael đĕch ôh, Sư rơih iŏk lu bơngai nai hai.

English: As He says also in Hosea: “I will call them My people, who were not My people, And her beloved, who was not beloved.”
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh sơ̆ 'bok Hôssê kư̆m chih roi nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi âu: “Lu bơngai tơmoi nai mă ưh kơ trŏ kơ khŭl kon Inh, Inh kư̆m krao lu sư kon Inh mơ̆n. Lu bơngai mă Inh ưh kơ gan 'mêm sơ̆, Inh gô 'mêm kơ sư tơpă.

English: “And it shall come to pass in the place where it was said to them, ‘You are not My people,’ There they shall be called sons of the living God.”
Bahnar: Mă tơ yơ yơ đe jô̆ lu sư khan ưh kơ trŏ kơ kon Inh, tơ noh đe gô jô̆ kơ lu sư kon Inh mơ̆n; yua kơ Inh Yang, 'Bă lu sư mă arih ling-lang.”

English: Isaiah also cries out concerning Israel: “Though the number of the children of Israel be as the sand of the sea, The remnant will be saved.
Bahnar: Gah tơdrong lu bơngai Isơrael, Êsai sư khan thoi âu: “Mă lu bơngai Isơrael lơlap lơlang dang pơlao chuơh dơsĭ, hui bơngai klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch

English: For He will finish the work and cut it short in righteousness, Because the LORD will make a short work upon the earth.”
Bahnar: yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă phak jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak.”

English: And as Isaiah said before: “Unless the LORD of Sabaoth had left us a seed, We would have become like Sodom, And we would have been made like Gomorrah.”
Bahnar: Êsai kư̆m khan lê̆ hơdrol sơ̆ thoi âu: “Dah Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ rong lê̆ bơ̆n 'biơ̆, lei kon bơngai bơ̆n lôch đĭ thoi Pơlei Sôđôm păng Gômôrơ sơ̆.”

English: What shall we say then? That Gentiles, who did not pursue righteousness, have attained to righteousness, even the righteousness of faith
Bahnar: Thoi noh na lu bơngai tơmoi nai mă ưh kơ khŭl Isơrael, sơ̆ lu sư ưh kơ băt chă tơdrong pơm 'lơ̆ng hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi yơ ôh, mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m 'mêm kơ lu sư mơ̆n, kư̆m jô̆ lu sư bơngai 'lơ̆ng. Lu bơngai noh wă khan dôm lu bơngai khŭl nai mă oei gơnang kơ Yêsu.

English: but Israel, pursuing the law of righteousness, has not attained to the law of righteousness.
Bahnar: Gah lu bơngai Isơrael lu sư gơnang kơ akâu kơdih đĕch wă kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă sơ̆ khan jing bơngai 'lơ̆ng hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei. Mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ kĕ kiơ̆ tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă ôh

English: Brethren, my heart’s desire and prayer to God for Israel is that they may be saved.
Bahnar: Ơ lu 'nhŏng oh, inh wă tơpă kơ lu bơngai Isơrael klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch. Inh krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei apinh tơdrong noh ling-lang.

English: For I bear them witness that they have a zeal for God, but not according to knowledge.
Bahnar: Inh băt mơ̆n lu sư adrin kiơ̆ tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei; mă-lei inh hli kơ lu sư kiơ̆ ưh kơ 'blep thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei wă.

English: For they being ignorant of God’s righteousness, and seeking to establish their own righteousness, have not submitted to the righteousness of God.
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ băt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ lu sư Yêsu, athei gơnang kơ Yêsu na gơh jing bơngai 'lơ̆ng hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei. Na 'nâu lu sư gơnang kơ akâu lu sư kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă, lu sư ưh kơ gơh klaih ôh.

English: For Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to everyone who believes.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai athei gơnang kơ Yêsu đĕch, 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ jing bơngai 'lơ̆ng hăm Sư. Bơ̆n gơnang kơ Yêsu thoi noh ưh pă kăl kơ gơnang kơ akâu kơdih kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă dơ̆ng ôh.

English: For Moses writes about the righteousness which is of the law, “The man who does those things shall live by them.”
Bahnar: Môis chih sơ̆ khan, bu wă kơ 'lơ̆ng hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei, sư athei kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă mă truh um nhen tơnen tơpă na sư 'lơ̆ng hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei gơh arih ling-lang.

English: But the righteousness of faith speaks in this way, “Do not say in your heart, ‘Who will ascend into heaven?’ ” (that is, to bring Christ down from above)
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdrong lui kơ Yêsu wă kơ 'lơ̆ng hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ anat ôh. Bơ̆n băt ưh kơ anat, na bơ̆n 'nĕ kơ pơma khan: Năm bĕ, bu tŏk krao kơ bơ̆n Yêsu đơ̆ng plĕnh

English: or, “ ‘Who will descend into the abyss?’ ” (that is, to bring Christ up from the dead).
Bahnar: dah đơ̆ng dêh atâu anhăk kơ bơ̆n tơ âu wă kơ Sư pơklaih bơ̆n.

English: But what does it say? “The word is near you, in your mouth and in your heart” (that is, the word of faith which we preach)
Bahnar: 'Noh ưh kơ kăl ôh. Tơ̆ng bơ̆n tŏk chă, noh kư̆m anat lei-lăi thoi bơ̆n gơnang kơ akâu bơ̆n kơdih wă kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă sơ̆, kư̆m ưh kơ gơh klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch ôh. Bơ̆n băt pôm lui kơ Yêsu Krist đĕch klaih tơpă đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch. Nhôn bơtho ăn kơ iĕm tơdrong lui kơ Yêsu Krist noh ưh kơ ataih, ưh kơ anat ôh; sư jê̆ jê̆ dang 'bơ̆t 'bơ̆r păng lăm jơhngơ̆m đon bơ̆n đĕch.

English: that if you confess with your mouth the Lord Jesus and believe in your heart that God has raised Him from the dead, you will be saved.
Bahnar: 'Noh wă khan dah 'bơ̆r bơ̆n ră roi kơ đe khan bơ̆n lui kơ Yêsu Krist Kră Yang bơ̆n, noh jơhngơ̆m đon bơ̆n lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơiung arih Yêsu đơ̆ng lôch boih, dôm noh đĕch bơ̆n klaih boih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch.

English: For with the heart one believes unto righteousness, and with the mouth confession is made unto salvation.
Bahnar: Dah jơhngơ̆m đon bơ̆n lui thoi noh, 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ bơ̆n bơngai 'lơ̆ng hăm Sư. 'Bơ̆r bơ̆n ră roi kơ đe thoi noh, Sư pơklaih bơ̆n đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch.

English: For the Scripture says, “Whoever believes on Him will not be put to shame.”
Bahnar: Hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei roi gah tơdrong 'Bok Krist thoi âu: “Bu lui kơ Sư, bơngai noh huay kơ hli minh tơdrong kiơ ôh.”

English: For there is no distinction between Jew and Greek, for the same Lord over all is rich to all who call upon Him.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Yêsu Krist Sư lăng rim khŭl bơngai lei-lăi đĕch, ưh kơ phara ôh. Sư lăng bơngai Isơrael kư̆m dang bơngai nai. Sư wei-lăng tơgŭm tơpă rim khŭl bơngai mă băt kơ krao khan apinh Sư.

English: For “whoever calls on the name of the LORD shall be saved.”
Bahnar: 'Noh kư̆m thoi hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei khan sơ̆ thoi âu: “Đĭ-đăng bơngai mă băt kơ krao khan apinh Sư, Kră Yang tơgŭm pơklaih lu sư lei-lăi đĕch.”

English: How then shall they call on Him in whom they have not believed? And how shall they believe in Him of whom they have not heard? And how shall they hear without a preacher?
Bahnar: Mă-lei dah ưh kơ đei bơngai năm bơtho, thoi yơ đe gơh krao khan adrol? Ưh kơ đei bơngai năm bơtho, thoi yơ đe gơh lui adrol? Ưh kơ đei bơngai năm bơtho thoi yơ đe gơh kơtơ̆ng adrol?

English: And how shall they preach unless they are sent? As it is written: “How beautiful are the feet of those who preach the gospel of peace, Who bring glad tidings of good things!”
Bahnar: Kră Yang ưh kơ đei wơh đe năm bơtho, thoi yơ đe gơh năm bơtho adrol? Mă-lei Sư đei wơh đe năm bơtho boih, yua kơ hla bơar Sư đei roi thoi âu: “Bơ̆n 'bôh đe bơtho tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng jơhngơ̆m bơ̆n hiôk dêh iih?”

English: But they have not all obeyed the gospel. For Isaiah says, “LORD, who has believed our report?”
Bahnar: Mă đei đe năm bơtho tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng ưh kơ sĭ đe lui đĭ hloi ôh, yua kơ tơdrong noh 'blep thoi tơdrong Êsai chih roi sơ̆ thoi âu: “Ơ Kră Yang, nhôn bơtho tơdrong Ih ră đe kuă kơ lui.”

English: So then faith comes by hearing, and hearing by the word of God.
Bahnar: Gah lu bơ̆n, bơ̆n lui boih, noh đơ̆ng đe năm bơtho tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng Yêsu Krist na bơ̆n lui.

English: But I say, have they not heard? Yes indeed: “Their sound has gone out to all the earth, And their words to the ends of the world.”
Bahnar: Inh wă jet iĕm, bơngai Isơrael tam kơtơ̆ng tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei? Lu sư kơtơ̆ng boih, lăm hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m roi thoi noh: “Đe năm bơtho tơdrong Kră Yang jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak, đơ̆ng hơlĕch truh tơ bơmơ̆t, đơ̆ng yă-nơ̆m truh tơ gơal.”

English: But I say, did Israel not know? First Moses says: “I will provoke you to jealousy by those who are not a nation, I will move you to anger by a foolish nation.”
Bahnar: Na inh wă jet iĕm thoi âu dơ̆ng: Lu bơngai Isơrael hăm hlôh đe bơtho tơdrong Yêsu? Lu sư hlôh mơ̆n kuă kơ lui đĕch. 'Noh kư̆m thoi Môis chih roi lăm hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma kơ lu bơngai Isơrael sơ̆ thoi âu: “Tơ̆ng lei, Inh wă tơgŭm lu dêh nai mă Inh ưh kơ gan 'mêm kơ lu sư sơ̆, wă kơ lu sư hlôh dang ei, na lu iĕm gô 'nhĕng lu sư, hil areh kơ lu sư.”

English: But Isaiah is very bold and says: “I was found by those who did not seek Me; I was made manifest to those who did not ask for Me.”
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh Êsai kư̆m chih pơjăm lu bôl sư bơngai Isơrael, mă-lei sư ưh kơ hli, sư chih kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi âu: “Lu bơngai mă ưh kơ băt chă Inh sơ̆, dang ei lu sư 'bôh Inh boih păng kơnăl kơ Inh, yua kơ Inh wih tơbăt kơ lu sư akâu Inh dơ̆ng.”

English: But to Israel he says: “All day long I have stretched out My hands To a disobedient and contrary people.”
Bahnar: Gah lu bơngai Isơrael 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: “Inh oei chang gô lu bơngai Isơrael ling-lang wă kơ lu sư jah wih tơ Inh, mă-lei lu sư oei arăng kơ̆l ưh kơ wă wih ôh.”

English: I say then, has God cast away His people? Certainly not! For I also am an Israelite, of the seed of Abraham, of the tribe of Benjamin.
Bahnar: Thoi noh ră, mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm hŭt lê̆ đe Isơrael? Ưh ôh, Sư oei 'mêm tơpă. Na inh âu boih bơngai Isơrael kư̆m kon sâu Abraham; inh đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung 'bok Bênjamin.

English: God has not cast away His people whom He foreknew. Or do you not know what the Scripture says of Elijah, how he pleads with God against Israel, saying
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ hŭt ôh lu bơngai Isơrael, yua kơ Sư rơih iŏk đơ̆ng sơ̆ boih. Iĕm kư̆m băt mơ̆n tơdrong Êli chih roi lăm hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei kơplah sư hil kơ lu bơngai Isơrael sơ̆.

English: “LORD, they have killed Your prophets and torn down Your altars, and I alone am left, and they seek my life”?
Bahnar: Sư khan: “Ơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, Ih lăng lu bơngai Isơrael pơlôch lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r Ih păng pơrăm dôm lu kơ'bang chơnang soi kơ Ih, na dang ei oei pă minh 'nu inh lui kơ Ih, lu sư kư̆m khan wă pơlôch mơ̆n.”

English: But what does the divine response say to him? “I have reserved for Myself seven thousand men who have not bowed the knee to Baal.”
Bahnar: Na 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma tơwih kơ sư thoi âu: “Ưh kơ trŏ kơdrô̆ ih ôh, Inh kư̆m rơih iŏk tơpơh-rơbâu 'nu bơngai lui kơ Inh mă ưh kơ chu lui kơ yang Baal.”

English: Even so then, at this present time there is a remnant according to the election of grace.
Bahnar: Na dang ei 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m wă rơih iŏk lu bơngai Isơrael thoi noh, lu bơngai noh Sư rơih iŏk yua kơ Sư mơnat.

English: And if by grace, then it is no longer of works; otherwise grace is no longer grace. But if it is of works, it is no longer grace; otherwise work is no longer work.
Bahnar: Sư rơih iŏk yua kơ Sư mơnat, ưh kơ sĭ yua kơ lu bơngai noh kĕ kiơ̆ tôm tơdrong juăt Sư pơkă ôh. Tơ̆ng Sư rơih iŏk lu bơngai noh kĕ kiơ̆ tôm tơdrong juăt Sư pơkă, lei thoi yơ 'Bok Kei-Dei khan Sư rơih iŏk yua kơ Sư mơnat đĕch?

English: What then? Israel has not obtained what it seeks; but the elect have obtained it, and the rest were blinded.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Isơrael chă tơdrong pơm 'lơ̆ng hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei ră, mă-lei ưh kơ gơh, pôm lu bơngai Isơrael mă 'Bok Kei-Dei rơih iŏk đĕch gơh. Gah lu bơngai mă 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ rơih iŏk, lu sư rai đunh rai arăng kơ̆l dêh.

English: Just as it is written: “God has given them a spirit of stupor, Eyes that they should not see And ears that they should not hear, To this very day.”
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh thoi tơdrong đe chih roi tơ lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆ thoi âu: “'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ lu sư jing bơngai kơtul. Lu sư đei ră măt ưh kơ gơh 'bôh, đei ră đon ưh kơ kơtơ̆ng truh tơ dang ei hloi.”

English: And David says: “Let their table become a snare and a trap, A stumbling block and a recompense to them.
Bahnar: Sơ̆ Đawit kư̆m pơma kơ tơdrong noh thoi âu: “Lu bơngai noh ưh kơ băt kơdih lu sư bơngai sa et bơlŭk, na lu sư jing lôch hiong yua kơ tơdrong lu sư sa et noh.

English: Let their eyes be darkened, so that they do not see, And bow down their back always.”
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei pơchĭt măt lu sư ling-lang, wă kơ lu sư hăl hang tôch đon khŏm khŏm.”

English: I say then, have they stumbled that they should fall? Certainly not! But through their fall, to provoke them to jealousy, salvation has come to the Gentiles.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Isơrael mă khan bơngai yoch dang noh, 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ achăng lê̆ lu sư hlŏng hloi ôh. Yua kơ lu bơngai Isơrael yoch, na 'Bok Kei-Dei pơklaih lu bơngai nai hơdrol, wă kơ lu bơngai Isơrael 'nhĕng na lui kiơ̆ thoi lu bơngai nai noh.

English: Now if their fall is riches for the world, and their failure riches for the Gentiles, how much more their fullness!
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu bơngai Isơrael yoch na lu bơngai nai jơ̆p kơ teh đak jing hiôk jơnap. Lu bơngai Isơrael ning-mônh gô lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei đĭ. Đĭ-đăng kơ bơ̆n jing hiôk jơnap hloh kơ chăl arih lu bơ̆n sơ̆.

English: For I speak to you Gentiles; inasmuch as I am an apostle to the Gentiles, I magnify my ministry
Bahnar: Na dang ei inh wă pơma kơ lu iĕm bơngai nai. 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ inh pơm jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu, wă kơ inh bơtho iĕm mă ưh kơ khŭl Isơrael. Yua kơ thoi noh na inh adrin tơpă kơ tơdrong jang inh

English: if by any means I may provoke to jealousy those who are my flesh and save some of them.
Bahnar: wă kơ lu bôl inh bơngai Isơrael 'nhĕng iĕm, na lui kiơ̆ iĕm, klaih kơ tơdrong yoch thoi iĕm.

English: For if their being cast away is the reconciling of the world, what will their acceptance be but life from the dead?
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ iŏk lu bơngai Isơrael dang ei yua kơ lu sư ưh kơ lui kơ Yêsu; noh na Sư ăn kơ iĕm lui hơdrol kơ lu sư, na dang ei iĕm hiôk hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei boih. Ning-mônh lu bơngai Isơrael kư̆m lui kơ Yêsu, 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m iŏk lu sư mơ̆n, lu sư gô hiôk dang kơ bơngai iung arih đơ̆ng lôch boih.

English: For if the firstfruit is holy, the lump is also holy; and if the root is holy, so are the branches.
Bahnar: Âu inh wă pơma kơ iĕm gah tơdrong đe pơyơ̆r kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei 'ba hrôih. Sư ăn pơgia lăp tŏ sĕt đĕch mă-lei dang sư ăn đĭ kơ 'ba sư mơ̆n. Bơ̆n 'bôh tơm 'long ayơ 'lơ̆ng, đĭ kơ dơng sư kư̆m 'lơ̆ng mơ̆n. Lu bơngai Isơrael kư̆m thoi noh, sơ̆ 'bok kơdră lu sư pơyơ̆r ăn akâu sư kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, noh kư̆m dang sư pơyơ̆r đĭ lu kon sâu sư mơ̆n; tơm sư ăn kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei boih, wĕch kư̆m thoi noh.

English: And if some of the branches were broken off, and you, being a wild olive tree, were grafted in among them, and with them became a partaker of the root and fatness of the olive tree
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Isơrael mă ưh kơ lui, lu sư dang kơ tơm 'long đei dơng đe wă chre hŭt. Na lu iĕm thoi tơm 'long mă chăt tơ bri brah, na đe wă chre iŏk dơng 'long tơ bri brah noh wă klop tơ dơng 'long mă đêl đe chre hŭt noh, wă kơ sư bluh 'lơ̆ng đei plei trem.

English: do not boast against the branches. But if you do boast, remember that you do not support the root, but the root supports you.
Bahnar: Mă-lei iĕm 'nĕ pơang kơ đe khan iĕm dơng 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ dơng mă đe chre hŭt noh, yua kơ iĕm dơng ưh kơ gơh chăt kơdih. Dơng sư arih yua kơ tơm, ưh kơ sĭ tơm arih yua kơ dơng ôh.

English: You will say then, “Branches were broken off that I might be grafted in.”
Bahnar: Păng inh hli kơ iĕm khan: “Đe chre hŭt dơng noh wă hơđơ̆ng kơ klop iŏk dơng đơ̆ng nhôn.”

English: Well said. Because of unbelief they were broken off, and you stand by faith. Do not be haughty, but fear.
Bahnar: Iĕm khan thoi noh trŏ mơ̆n mă-lei yua kơ kiơ 'Bok Kei-Dei chre hŭt dơng noh? Yua kơ sư ưh kơ chu lui. Na iĕm kư̆m lei-lăi, yua kơ iĕm lui na Sư klop tơ noh. 'Noh na iĕm 'nĕ pơang kơ đe, kơnh 'Bok Kei-Dei chre hŭt iĕm dơ̆ng.

English: For if God did not spare the natural branches, He may not spare you either.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Isơrael mơ'nah kuă kơ lui tơpă na 'Bok Kei-Dei chre hŭt dơng lu sư. Mă iĕm kư̆m lei-lăi, tơ̆ng iĕm kuă kơ lui Sư kư̆m chre hŭt iĕm mơ̆n 'bônh loi yua kơ iĕm dơng đơ̆ng nai.

English: Therefore consider the goodness and severity of God: on those who fell, severity; but toward you, goodness, if you continue in His goodness. Otherwise you also will be cut off.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm tơpă kơ kon bơngai, mă-lei Sư kư̆m hil kơ kon bơngai mơ̆n. Sư hil kơ lu bơngai mă kuă kơ lui kơ Sư. Gah lu iĕm Sư ưh kơ hil ôh yua kơ iĕm oei lui păng gơnang kơ Sư tơpă. Dah iĕm kuă kơ lui, Sư kư̆m chre hŭt dơng iĕm mơ̆n.

English: And they also, if they do not continue in unbelief, will be grafted in, for God is able to graft them in again.
Bahnar: Păng dah lu bơngai Isơrael lui kơ Sư dơ̆ng, Sư kư̆m gơh pơklop tơduă dơng Isơrael, ưh kơ anat ôh 'bônh đĕch.

English: For if you were cut out of the olive tree which is wild by nature, and were grafted contrary to nature into a cultivated olive tree, how much more will these, who are natural branches, be grafted into their own olive tree?
Bahnar: Iĕm bơngai nai ưh kơ trŏ khŭl Isơrael, 'Bok Kei-Dei krao iĕm lui kơ Sư dang lĕ kơ dơng 'long tơ bri brah chô̆ pơklop kơ 'long mă đe pơtăm. Mă-lei dah 'Bok Kei-Dei wă iŏk dơng đêl Sư chre hŭt pơklop ming dơ̆ng kư̆m gơh 'bônh hloh dơ̆ng.

English: For I do not desire, brethren, that you should be ignorant of this mystery, lest you should be wise in your own opinion, that blindness in part has happened to Israel until the fullness of the Gentiles has come in.
Bahnar: Ơ 'nhŏng oh, inh ưh kơ wă kơ iĕm pơang kơ đe khan iĕm bơngai hơgei hloh kơ bơngai Isơrael ôh. Na dang ei inh wă tơbăt ăn kơ iĕm minh tơdrong âu mă 'Bok Kei-Dei tam mă tơbăt ăn kơ bơ̆n đơ̆ng sơ̆, tơdrong noh thoi âu: Lu bơngai Isơrael mơ'nah kuă tơpă boih lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, noh na Sư ăn kơ lu bơngai mă kuă noh jing arăng kơ̆l khŏm khŏm truh tơ Sư krao tôm kơ lu khŭl nai bu mă Sư rơih iŏk lui kơ Sư.

English: And so all Israel will be saved, as it is written: “The Deliverer will come out of Zion, And He will turn away ungodliness from Jacob
Bahnar: 'Noh na đĭ lu bơngai Isơrael băt kơ 'nhĕng lu bơngai khŭl nai lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, na đĭ lu sư wang lui kiơ̆, lu sư klaih đĭ dôm tơdrong yoch. Tơdrong noh kư̆m thoi đe chih roi lăm hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆ thoi âu: “'Bok Dŏng Pơklaih wă năm đơ̆ng Pơlei Siôn tơ rim pơlei Isơrael, wă pơpuh tơjăk đĭ dôm tơdrong yoch đe Isơrael.

English: For this is My covenant with them, When I take away their sins.”
Bahnar: Na Inh gô pơklaih tơdrong yoch lu sư 'blep thoi Inh pơkă kơ lu sư sơ̆.”

English: Concerning the gospel they are enemies for your sake, but concerning the election they are beloved for the sake of the fathers.
Bahnar: Dang ei lu bơngai Isơrael mơ'nah ưh tam mă lui kơ tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng Yêsu, lu sư dang ayăt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei oei 'mêm kơ lu sư. Yua kơ thoi noh na Sư krao iĕm lui kơ Yêsu hơdrol kơ lu sư, wă kơ lu sư kiơ̆ iĕm. Sư 'mêm tơpă kơ lu bơngai Isơrael yua kơ Sư rơih iŏk lu yă 'bok lu sư đơ̆ng hơdrol sơ̆ hloi boih.

English: For the gifts and the calling of God are irrevocable.
Bahnar: Yua kơ nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă wă rơih iŏk đe Isơrael, tơgŭm đe Isơrael, na Sư ưh kơ hŭt ôh lu bơngai Isơrael noh.

English: For as you were once disobedient to God, yet have now obtained mercy through their disobedience
Bahnar: Lu iĕm bơngai khŭl nai, sơ̆ iĕm ưh kơ băt kơ lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi lu bơngai noh ôh. Lu bơngai noh lu sư băt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei mă lu sư kuă kơ lui. 'Noh na 'Bok Kei-Dei mơnat kơ iĕm krao iĕm lui kơ Sư.

English: even so these also have now been disobedient, that through the mercy shown you they also may obtain mercy.
Bahnar: Lu đe Isơrael mơ'nah arăng kơ̆l kuă kơ lui kơ Yêsu truh dang ei, 'Bok Kei-Dei mơnat dêh, thoi Sư mơnat kơ iĕm.

English: For God has committed them all to disobedience, that He might have mercy on all.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ đĭ-đăng bơngai yoch ngăl, na Sư 'mêm Sư wă tơgŭm đĭ rim khŭl kon bơngai.

English: Oh, the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and knowledge of God! How unsearchable are His judgments and His ways past finding out!
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm thoi noh bơ̆n băt kơ Sư 'mêm kơ bơ̆n tơpă păng bơ̆n kư̆m băt kơ Sư hơgei dêh. Na bơ̆n kon bơngai ưh kơ băt ôh tơdrong tơchĕng Sư thoi yơ.

English: “For who has known the mind of the LORD? Or who has become His counselor?”
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh kư̆m thoi đe chih lăm hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi âu: “Bơ̆n kon bơngai ưh kơ băt ôh tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei tơchĕng thoi yơ, păng ưh kơ đei bu bơtho Sư tăm.

English: “Or who has first given to Him And it shall be repaid to him?”
Bahnar: Sư ưh kơ kơ'bah, mă ưh kơ đei bu tơgŭm.

English: For of Him and through Him and to Him are all things, to whom be glory forever. Amen.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Sư gơh pơjing kơdih tôm tơdrong păng Sư gơh pơgơ̆r wei-lăng tôm tơdrong. Tôm tơdrong noh wă kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai ư-ang kơ Sư. Na bĕ bơ̆n ư-ang kơ Sư ưh kơ layơ tôch. A-men.”

English: I beseech you therefore, brethren, by the mercies of God, that you present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable to God, which is your reasonable service.
Bahnar: Ơ lu 'nhŏng oh, bơ̆n băt boih 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm kơ bơ̆n tôch bơneh dang noh, na bơ̆n athei pơjao akâu bơ̆n kơ Sư, 'nĕ pă pơm yoch, pơm kiơ̆ kơ Sư đĕch, noh na Sư lăp đon kơ bơ̆n.

English: And do not be conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind, that you may prove what is that good and acceptable and perfect will of God.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n 'nĕ pă pơm yoch tôm tơdrong kơnê̆ thoi lu bơngai tơ teh âu juăt kơ pơm. Bơ̆n athei pơjao akâu bơ̆n kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơplih jơhngơ̆m đon bơ̆n jing 'nao wă kơ bơ̆n băt tôm tơdrong Sư, tơdrong trŏ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt ngăl.

English: For I say, through the grace given to me, to everyone who is among you, not to think of himself more highly than he ought to think, but to think soberly, as God has dealt to each one a measure of faith.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ inh pơm jơ̆ng 'bang Sư wă kơ inh bơtho ăn kơ iĕm tơdrong Sư, Sư wă kơ iĕm huay kơ pơang kơ đe khan iĕm bơngai hơgei hloh kơ bơngai nai. 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ iĕm hơgei pơm kiơ, gơh jang tơdrong kiơ, iĕm kư̆ kơ jang đĕch kăl kiơ pơang kơ đe.

English: For as we have many members in one body, but all the members do not have the same function
Bahnar: Akâu bơngai bơ̆n đei lơ chăl, hơdôm chăl noh pơjing kơ minh 'nu bơngai, rim kơ chăl noh ưh kơ jang lei-lăi ôh.

English: so we, being many, are one body in Christ, and individually members of one another.
Bahnar: Lu bơ̆n bơngai lui kơ Sư kư̆m thoi noh, lu bơ̆n jing minh jơhngơ̆m minh đon păng Yêsu Krist, tơduă bơ̆n kư̆m pơm minh jơhngơ̆m minh đon lei-lăi.

English: Having then gifts differing according to the grace that is given to us, let us use them: if prophecy, let us prophesy in proportion to our faith
Bahnar: Na 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ bơ̆n phara tơdrong hơgei, mơ'nah sư hơgei pơm kiơ, gơh jang tơdrong kiơ, na bơ̆n athei jang kiơ̆ kơ Sư ăn noh. Dah Sư ăn kơ bơ̆n hơgei gơh tơbăt kơ đe tơdrong Sư, bơ̆n kư̆ kơ jang tơdrong noh. Bơ̆n gơh dang yơ bơ̆n jang dang noh.

English: or ministry, let us use it in our ministering; he who teaches, in teaching
Bahnar: Dah Sư ăn kơ bơ̆n hơgei gah tơdrong tơgŭm đe, bơ̆n kư̆ kơ jang tơdrong noh. Dah Sư ăn kơ bơ̆n hơgei gah tơdrong bơtho, bơ̆n kư̆ adrin bơtho đe.

English: he who exhorts, in exhortation; he who gives, with liberality; he who leads, with diligence; he who shows mercy, with cheerfulness.
Bahnar: Dah Sư ăn kơ bơ̆n hơgei gah tơdrong gơh pơlung đe lui kơjăp, bơ̆n kư̆m adrin gah tơdrong pơlung đe lui kơjăp. Sư wă kơ bơ̆n hơlăng kơ bơngai dơnuh tơmam, bơ̆n kư̆m adrin jang kiơ̆ thoi noh. Dah Sư ăn kơ bơ̆n wei-lăng đe, bơ̆n adrin wei-lăng đe. Dah Sư wă kơ bơ̆n tơgŭm lu bơngai pơmat-tat, bơ̆n athei tơgŭm lu bơngai pơmat-tat noh tơpă păng ăn kơ jơhngơ̆m bơ̆n pơm hiôk kơ lu sư.

English: Let love be without hypocrisy. Abhor what is evil. Cling to what is good.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n 'mêm kơ bôl athei 'mêm mă tơpă, areh kơ tơdrong kơnê̆, athei adrin chă tơdrong 'lơ̆ng.

English: Be kindly affectionate to one another with brotherly love, in honor giving preference to one another
Bahnar: Bơ̆n 'mêm kơ bôl, athei dang bơ̆n 'mêm kơ 'nhŏng oh bơ̆n kơdih. Bơ̆n 'nĕ bơnê kơ akâu bơ̆n kơdih, bơ̆n ling-lang athei bơnê kơ đe, pơm hiôk kơ jơhngơ̆m đe.

English: not lagging in diligence, fervent in spirit, serving the Lord
Bahnar: Bơ̆n adrin jang tơdrong Kră Yang tôch bơneh kơ bơ̆n jang.

English: rejoicing in hope, patient in tribulation, continuing steadfastly in prayer
Bahnar: Bơ̆n băt kơ ning-mônh 'Bok Kei-Dei wă ăn kơ bơ̆n oei hiôk jơnap tơpă, na dang ei bơ̆n kư̆m pơm hiôk thoi ning-mônh. Mă bơ̆n đei tơdrong gleh pơmat, mă đe hil areh kơ bơ̆n, bơ̆n kư̆ adrin jang khŏm khŏm đĕch, mă-lei 'nĕ hiơt tơdrong krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: distributing to the needs of the saints, given to hospitality.
Bahnar: Tơduă bơ̆n bơngai lui 'nĕ kơ kret băl tơmam, tơmoi truh athei băt kơ sơng iŏk tơ hnam.

English: Bless those who persecute you; bless and do not curse.
Bahnar: Mă đe pơm kơnê̆ kơ bơ̆n, bơ̆n 'nĕ kơ blei hiap đe, bơ̆n rai krao khan apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei mơnat kơ sư dơ̆ng.

English: Rejoice with those who rejoice, and weep with those who weep.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n 'bôh đe hiôk, bơ̆n kư̆m hơdai hiôk; bơ̆n 'bôh đe sơ'ngon, bơ̆n kư̆m hơdai sơ'ngon.

English: Be of the same mind toward one another. Do not set your mind on high things, but associate with the humble. Do not be wise in your own opinion.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n athei kiơ̆ kơ jơhngơ̆m đon bôl buăl lăp đon, 'nĕ pơang akâu bơ̆n kơ sư; mă loi bơ̆n athei tơbôl hăm lu bơngai dơnuh, pơma dơnuh pơlung sư mă hiôk.

English: Repay no one evil for evil. Have regard for good things in the sight of all men.
Bahnar: Đe pơm kơnê̆ kơ bơ̆n, bơ̆n 'nĕ pơm tơwih kơ đe, bơ̆n athei pơm 'lơ̆ng pơm trŏ, pơm kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong bôl buăl mă lăp đon; bơ̆n pơm thoi noh đĕch 'lơ̆ng.

English: If it is possible, as much as depends on you, live peaceably with all men.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n 'nĕ kơ pơm dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ wă kơ bơ̆n oei hiôk hơiă hăm đĭ-đăng bơngai.

English: Beloved, do not avenge yourselves, but rather give place to wrath; for it is written, “Vengeance is Mine, I will repay,” says the Lord.
Bahnar: Ơ 'nhŏng oh mă inh 'mêm kơeng, bơ̆n 'nĕ kơ pơm tơwih kơ đe tơdrong kơnê̆ hŏ, gô mơ̆ng kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm tơwih đĕch 'bơ 'bang. Yua kơ tơdrong noh sơ̆ 'Bok Kei-Dei đei khan thoi âu: “Lê̆ kơ Inh pơm tơwih kơ bơngai pơm kơnê̆ noh; Inh gô phak sư yua kơ sư pơm kơnê̆.”

English: Therefore “If your enemy is hungry, feed him; If he is thirsty, give him a drink; For in so doing you will heap coals of fire on his head.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh na bơ̆n huay kơ kăl pơm kơnê̆ kơ đe. Lăm hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m đei khan dơ̆ng thoi âu: “Bu pơm kơnê̆ kơ bơ̆n, kơnh pơgê bơ̆n 'bôh sư pơngot dah kơ'bah tơmam kiơ, bơ̆n rai tơgŭm bơngai noh; dah sư ol kơ đak bơ̆n ăn nhă. Dah bơ̆n pơm kơ sư thoi noh, noh sư huay pơm kơnê̆ kơ bơ̆n, sư wih mơlâu kơ bơ̆n dơ̆ng.”

English: Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na bơ̆n 'nĕ pơm tơwih kơ sư tơdrong kơnê̆; bơ̆n pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ sư đĕch wih jei bơ̆n.

English: Let every soul be subject to the governing authorities. For there is no authority except from God, and the authorities that exist are appointed by God.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kơ bơ̆n athei chu yom kơ bơngai mă pơgơ̆r bơ̆n. Tơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ ăn, ưh kơ đei bu gơh pơgơ̆r. Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai pơgơ̆r đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn ngăl.

English: Therefore whoever resists the authority resists the ordinance of God, and those who resist will bring judgment on themselves.
Bahnar: Thoi noh tơ̆ng bu ưh kơ chu yom kơ bơngai mă pơgơ̆r bơ̆n, bơngai noh dang sư ưh kơ chu yom kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, yua kơ lu bơngai noh đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn pơgơ̆r; na tơ̆ng bu ưh kơ chu, đe rôp phak bơngai noh.

English: For rulers are not a terror to good works, but to evil. Do you want to be unafraid of the authority? Do what is good, and you will have praise from the same.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơgơ̆r ưh kơ sĭ sư wă rôp phak lu bơngai pơm 'lơ̆ng ôh, sư rôp phak lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆. Tơ̆ng bơ̆n wă huay kơ hli kơ lu bơngai pơgơ̆r, bơ̆n athei pơm 'lơ̆ng na lu sư bơnê.

English: For he is God’s minister to you for good. But if you do evil, be afraid; for he does not bear the sword in vain; for he is God’s minister, an avenger to execute wrath on him who practices evil.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơgơ̆r noh lu sư dang jang tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei, wă kơ kon bơngai arih hiôk-hian. 'Noh na tơ̆ng bơ̆n pơm kơnê̆, bơ̆n hli kơ lu sư. Lu bơngai pơgơ̆r chĕp tak đao, lu sư trŏ tơdrong gơh chĕp. Yua kơ lu sư jang tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei, lu sư gơh rôp phak lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ mă 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ lăp đon.

English: Therefore you must be subject, not only because of wrath but also for conscience’ sake.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na bơ̆n athei chu yom kơ lu bơngai mă pơgơ̆r bơ̆n, wă kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei lăp đon kơ bơ̆n păng wă kơ bơ̆n đei jơhngơ̆m hiôk, yua kơ bơ̆n pơm trŏ.

English: For because of this you also pay taxes, for they are God’s ministers attending continually to this very thing.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na mă sư iŏk thuê̆ đơ̆ng bơ̆n trŏ tơpă, yua kơ lu sư dang jang tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Render therefore to all their due: taxes to whom taxes are due, customs to whom customs, fear to whom fear, honor to whom honor.
Bahnar: Păng yua kơ thoi noh na tơdrong kiơ trŏ kơ bơ̆n ăn, bơ̆n athei ăn; 'bok pơgơ̆r sư wă iŏk thuê̆ đơ̆ng bơ̆n, bơ̆n athei ăn kơ sư; sư wă kơ bơ̆n pơm kiơ, bơ̆n chu pơm.

English: Owe no one anything except to love one another, for he who loves another has fulfilled the law.
Bahnar: Tơdrong bơ̆n hre kơ đe, bơ̆n athei jah ăn na jah tôch. Mă gah tơdrong 'mêm kơ bôl buăl ưh kơ tôch ôh. Bơngai bu 'mêm kơ bôl buăl, bơngai noh ưh kơ hŭt ôh dôm tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă.

English: For the commandments, “You shall not commit adultery,” “You shall not murder,” “You shall not steal,” “You shall not bear false witness,” “You shall not covet,” and if there is any other commandment, are all summed up in this saying, namely, “You shall love your neighbor as yourself.”
Bahnar: Tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă sơ̆ thoi âu: Iĕm 'nĕ plah klo kăn đe, 'nĕ pơlôch bơngai, 'nĕ kơ tơtông, 'nĕ kơ 'nhĕng mŭk tơmam đe, mă tơdrong juăt nai kư̆m thoi tơdrong juăt Sư pơkă âu: Athei 'mêm kơ bôl buăl thoi iĕm 'mêm akâu kơdih.

English: Love does no harm to a neighbor; therefore love is the fulfillment of the law.
Bahnar: 'Noh na tơ̆ng bơ̆n 'mêm kơ bôl buăl, bơ̆n ưh kơ pơm kơnê̆ kơ bôl buăl ôh. Tơ̆ng bơ̆n 'mêm kơ bôl buăl bơ̆n gô răk đĭ dôm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă kơ bơ̆n noh.

English: And do this, knowing the time, that now it is high time to awake out of sleep; for now our salvation is nearer than when we first believed.
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong inh bơtho iĕm âu, bơ̆n athei răk pơm kiơ̆ tơpă, yua kơ Kră Yang Yêsu Krist wă jê̆ jur boih; tơdrong noh iĕm kư̆m băt mơ̆n. Tơm hmơm bơ̆n lui sơ̆, năr Yêsu Krist jur oei đunh 'biơ̆; mă dang ei ưh pă đunh boih. Na bơ̆n athei adrin kral ling-lang 'nĕ pă nŏng kơ tep.

English: The night is far spent, the day is at hand. Therefore let us cast off the works of darkness, and let us put on the armor of light.
Bahnar: Dang ei oei măng mu, ưh pă đunh 'năr gô lĕch. Yua kơ thoi noh na bơ̆n 'nĕ pă oei tơ lăm măng mu, bơ̆n athei oei tơ hơdah ling-lang wă kơ gơh tơblah păng yang kơnê̆.

English: Let us walk properly, as in the day, not in revelry and drunkenness, not in lewdness and lust, not in strife and envy.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n athei pơm mă 'lơ̆ng thoi bơngai jang kơ'năr, 'nĕ pă et sik suai hli kơ pơm kư̆ kă; drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn kư̆m 'nĕ kơ ngôi kư̆ kă; 'nĕ pơjah pơjăng păng đe, 'nĕ kơ 'nhĕng đe.

English: But put on the Lord Jesus Christ, and make no provision for the flesh, to fulfill its lusts.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n athei pơm 'lơ̆ng thoi Kră Yang bơ̆n Yêsu Krist sơ̆, Sư pơm 'lơ̆ng ling-lang. Bơ̆n 'nĕ kơ ăn akâu bơ̆n pơlung đon bơ̆n pơm ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng.

English: Receive one who is weak in the faith, but not to disputes over doubtful things.
Bahnar: Gah lu bơngai lui mă ưh tam mă hlôh tôm tơdrong, bơ̆n athei 'mêm kơ sư mơ̆n. Bơ̆n 'nĕ kơ pơjah pơjăng tơdrong sư ưh tam mă hlôh noh.

English: For one believes he may eat all things, but he who is weak eats only vegetables.
Bahnar: Pơtih gia minh 'nu bơngai lui, sư hlôh boih tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei na sư gơh sa tôm tơdrong tơmam sa. Minh 'nu bơngai lui nai ưh tam mă hlôh, sư sŏng sa mơh 'nhot đĕch, ưh kơ sa 'nhĕm.

English: Let not him who eats despise him who does not eat, and let not him who does not eat judge him who eats; for God has received him.
Bahnar: Na bơngai mă gơh sa tôm tơdrong 'nhĕm 'nhot noh 'nĕ kơ pơjăm bơngai mă giĕng kơ sa. Bơngai mă giĕng kơ sa kư̆m 'nĕ kơ pơjăm bơngai mă gơh sa, yua kơ bơngai mă gơh sa noh 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m jô̆ khan kon Sư mơ̆n.

English: Who are you to judge another’s servant? To his own master he stands or falls. Indeed, he will be made to stand, for God is able to make him stand.
Bahnar: Dah bơ̆n pơjăm sư, dang bơ̆n sek tơlang đĭch đe, khan bơngai đĭch noh pơm ưh kơ lăp kơ yŏng sư. Bơ̆n gô mơ̆ng kơ yŏng sư sek tơlang kơdih đĕch, gơh jô̆ kơ sư pơm 'lơ̆ng pơm ưh. Yŏng sư noh wă khan Yêsu Krist, Yŏng sư noh gơh tơgŭm sư lui kơjăp khŏm khŏm.

English: One person esteems one day above another; another esteems every day alike. Let each be fully convinced in his own mind.
Bahnar: Na tơdrong âu dơ̆ng: Đei lu buăl bơ̆n bơngai lui mơ'nah khan, mưh trŏ kơ năr giĕng pơm giĕng, athei oei pơdơh kiơ̆ kơ bơngai Juđê juăt sơ̆. Mă-lei lu buăl nai mơ'nah khan năr noh lei-lăi kơ năr nai đĕch, ưh kơ đei khan năr giĕng ôh. Tơdrong noh gô mơ̆ng kơ bơ̆n tơchĕng kơdih mă-lei bơ̆n athei tơchĕng mă nhên 'mơ̆i na băt kơ năr giĕng tơpă dah ưh, gơh oei kiơ̆ dah ưh.

English: He who observes the day, observes it to the Lord; and he who does not observe the day, to the Lord he does not observe it. He who eats, eats to the Lord, for he gives God thanks; and he who does not eat, to the Lord he does not eat, and gives God thanks.
Bahnar: Bơngai mă oei kiơ̆ rim kơ năr giĕng, yua kơ sư 'mêm kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei na sư oei kiơ̆. Na tơdrong sa 'nhĕm 'nhot kư̆m thoi noh; bơngai mă tơchĕng gơh sa sư kư̆m 'mêm kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei mơ̆n; bơngai mă tơchĕng khan giĕng kơ sa, sư kư̆m 'mêm kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Bơngai mă gơh sa sư băt tôm tơdrong tơmam sa 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing wă ăn kơ kon bơngai sa na sư bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Bơngai mă giĕng kơ sa sư kư̆m lei-lăi, sư giĕng kơ sa yua kơ sư wă kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei na sư kư̆m bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei mơ̆n.

English: For none of us lives to himself, and no one dies to himself.
Bahnar: Bĭ tơdrong Sư ăn kơ bơ̆n arih, ưh kơ sĭ Sư ăn kơ bơ̆n arih wă pơyua akâu bơ̆n arih hiôk jơnap ôh. Tơdrong lôch kư̆m lei-lăi, ưh kơ sĭ Sư ăn kơ bơ̆n lôch wă pơyua akâu bơ̆n ôh.

English: For if we live, we live to the Lord; and if we die, we die to the Lord. Therefore, whether we live or die, we are the Lord’s.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n arih wă pơyua Kră Yang, bơ̆n lôch kư̆m lei-lăi thoi noh. Mă arih, mă lôch gô mơ̆ng kơ Sư đĕch ưh kơ gơh pơyua akâu bơ̆n ôh.

English: For to this end Christ died and rose and lived again, that He might be Lord of both the dead and the living.
Bahnar: Truh trong tơdrong lôch, tơdrong arih, pôm Yêsu Krist đĕch truh, pôm Sư đĕch gơh pơgơ̆r bơngai lôch, bơngai arih.

English: But why do you judge your brother? Or why do you show contempt for your brother? For we shall all stand before the judgment seat of Christ.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh na lơliơ iĕm gơh sek tơlang 'nhŏng oh khan bơngai yoch bơngai ưh? Lơliơ iĕm gơh pơjăm sư lĕ? Ning-mônh đĭ-đăng bơ̆n gô dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp 'Bok Kei-Dei sek tơlang ngăl.

English: For it is written: “As I live, says the LORD, Every knee shall bow to Me, And every tongue shall confess to God.”
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh gô 'blep thoi đe chih roi tơ lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆ thoi âu: “Inh 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang iĕm, Inh đei tơpă păng Inh arih ling-lang, na ning-mônh đĭ-đăng kon bơngai sơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng kơkuh kơ Inh păng ư-ang Inh.”

English: So then each of us shall give account of himself to God.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei khan thoi noh boih, na ning-mônh đĭ-đăng kon bơngai bơ̆n gô roi tơdrong arih bơ̆n 'bơ̆t anăp Sư.

English: Therefore let us not judge one another anymore, but rather resolve this, not to put a stumbling block or a cause to fall in our brother’s way.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n băt tơdrong noh thoi noh boih, na bơ̆n 'nĕ pă chă sek tơlang dih băl khan bơngai yoch bơngai ưh, bơ̆n 'nĕ kơ pơm kơ sư hơwơ̆l hli kơ sư jing yoch.

English: I know and am convinced by the Lord Jesus that there is nothing unclean of itself; but to him who considers anything to be unclean, to him it is unclean.
Bahnar: Yua kơ inh lui kơ Yêsu Krist păng inh gơnang kơ Sư tơpă, na inh băt tôm tơdrong tơmam sa, ưh kơ đei tơmam sa ayơ bơ̆n sa khan yoch. Đơ̆ng đon bơ̆n tơchĕng khan yoch đĕch na jing yoch.

English: Yet if your brother is grieved because of your food, you are no longer walking in love. Do not destroy with your food the one for whom Christ died.
Bahnar: Na đơ̆ng âu tơ anăp dah 'nhŏng oh bơngai lui bơ̆n khan 'nĕ kơ sa tơmam noh bơ̆n giĕng, bơ̆n kư̆m 'nĕ kơ sa kiơ̆ kơ sư khan. Dah bơ̆n kư̆ kơ sa, đe jô̆ bưh kiơ bưh, noh ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng ôh, hli kơ sư hơwơ̆l, dang bơ̆n pơyoch sư mơ̆n. Păng bơ̆n jing ưh kơ đei tơdrong 'mêm kơ 'nhŏng oh thoi Yêsu lôch tang bơ̆n, yua kơ hơlŏng bơlŭk bơ̆n đĕch.

English: Therefore do not let your good be spoken of as evil
Bahnar: Tơmam sa kiơ bơ̆n tơchĕng gơh sa, mă-lei đe khan ưh, noh bơ̆n 'nĕ kơ sa, hli kơ đe jô̆ kơ bơ̆n bơngai yoch.

English: for the kingdom of God is not eating and drinking, but righteousness and peace and joy in the Holy Spirit.
Bahnar: Na bơ̆n bơngai mă 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r boih, mah kăl kiơ kơ sa 'nhĕm 'nhot thoi noh, mah 'nhĕng kiơ kơ đe sa et tơdrong 'noh. Tơdrong bơ̆n pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, tơdrong bơ̆n pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ bôl buăl, tơdrong bơ̆n chơt ngă 'nă hal yua kơ đei Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng, tơdrong noh bơ̆n kăl.

English: For he who serves Christ in these things is acceptable to God and approved by men.
Bahnar: Bơngai mă lui yom kơ Yêsu thoi noh, bơngai noh 'Bok Kei-Dei lăp đon, mă tơduă kon bơngai kư̆m lăp đon mơ̆n.

English: Therefore let us pursue the things which make for peace and the things by which one may edify another.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh na bơ̆n athei adrin 'biơ̆ tơdrong pơm hiôk kơ bôl buăl hăm 'nhŏng oh bơ̆n kơdih, rai băt tơgŭm băl lui kơjăp.

English: Do not destroy the work of God for the sake of food. All things indeed are pure, but it is evil for the man who eats with offense.
Bahnar: Tơdrong sa et iĕ ioch đĕch na wă pơrăm 'nhŏng oh bôl buăl kiơ̆ tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei. Bơ̆n băt dôm tơmam sa bơ̆n gơh sa ngăl, mă-lei dah 'nhŏng oh bơ̆n yoch yua kơ bơ̆n sa, noh măk ai kơ bơ̆n mă sa noh boih yua kơ bơ̆n dang pơyoch sư.

English: It is good neither to eat meat nor drink wine nor do anything by which your brother stumbles or is offended or is made weak.
Bahnar: Tơ̆ng bơ̆n kuă kơ pơyoch 'nhŏng oh bôl buăl, lei bơ̆n 'nĕ kơ pơm minh tơdrong kiơ kiơ hli kơ sư yoch, thoi lĕ kơ sa 'nhĕm 'nhot, dah et sik, dah tơdrong kiơ kiơ nai.

English: Do you have faith? Have it to yourself before God. Happy is he who does not condemn himself in what he approves.
Bahnar: Mă tơdrong sa et, mă tơdrong kiơ, bơ̆n tơchĕng gơh, mă bơ̆n 'nĕ roi kơ đe, gô mơ̆ng kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch bơtho bơ̆n. Dah bơ̆n tơchĕng trŏ lei lăm jơhngơ̆m bơ̆n mơn kơ hiôk ưh kơ hli kơ yoch ôh.

English: But he who doubts is condemned if he eats, because he does not eat from faith; for whatever is not from faith is sin.
Bahnar: Mă tơdrong sa, mă tơdrong kiơ kiơ noh nai bơ̆n tơchĕng khan băt giĕng băt ưh, mă-lei bơ̆n kư̆ kơ pơm, noh bơ̆n yoch boih yua kơ bơ̆n ưh kơ kiơ̆ kơ đon lui bơ̆n.

English: We then who are strong ought to bear with the scruples of the weak, and not to please ourselves.
Bahnar: Lu bơ̆n bơngai mă lui kơjăp boih athei băt tơgŭm lu bơngai lui rơdu, 'nĕ pơjah pơjăng tơdrong sư lui rơdu ưh tam mă kơjăp noh, bơ̆n 'nĕ pơma kơ sư kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong lui bơ̆n.

English: Let each of us please his neighbor for his good, leading to edification.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kơ bơ̆n athei tơchĕng kiơ̆ kơ bôl lăp đon, tơgŭm sư gơh lui kơjăp

English: For even Christ did not please Himself; but as it is written, “The reproaches of those who reproached You fell on Me.”
Bahnar: kư̆m thoi Yêsu ưh kơ pơm kiơ̆ kơ đon Sư kơdih ôh. 'Noh kư̆m thoi đe chih roi tơdrong Sư pơma kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆ khan: “Dôm tơdrong đe hil areh kơ Ih kư̆m hil areh kơ Inh mơ̆n.”

English: For whatever things were written before were written for our learning, that we through the patience and comfort of the Scriptures might have hope.
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong đe chih roi lê̆ sơ̆ wă bơtho kơ đon bơ̆n dang ei, wă kơ bơ̆n gơh lui kơjăp oei hiôk kơplah bơ̆n chang gô 'Bok Kei-Dei wă tơgŭm bơ̆n ning-mônh.

English: Now may the God of patience and comfort grant you to be like-minded toward one another, according to Christ Jesus
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ bơ̆n đei đon lui kơjăp păng ăn kơ bơ̆n oei hiôk, na inh apinh Sư ăn kơ iĕm oei hiôk gơh găt dih băl, kư̆m thoi Yêsu Krist bơngai gơh găt păng bơ̆n.

English: that you may with one mind and one mouth glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na đĭ-đăng kơ iĕm jing pôm 'bơ̆r pôm đon ư-ang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mă 'Bă Yŏng Kơdră bơ̆n Yêsu Krist.

English: Therefore receive one another, just as Christ also received us, to the glory of God.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh na iĕm 'nĕ kơ pơdê dih băl, kư̆m thoi Yêsu Krist ưh kơ layơ Sư pơdê bơ̆n, Sư wă kơ đe ư-ang 'Bok Kei-Dei ngăl.

English: Now I say that Jesus Christ has become a servant to the circumcision for the truth of God, to confirm the promises made to the fathers
Bahnar: Yêsu Krist iŏk tơdrong pơmat-tat wă tơgŭm lu bơngai Juđê, wă kơ lu bơngai Juđê băt tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma tơpăt pơkă kơ lu yă 'bok sư sơ̆ khan wă tơgŭm lu bơngai Juđê.

English: and that the Gentiles might glorify God for His mercy, as it is written: “For this reason I will confess to You among the Gentiles, And sing to Your name.”
Bahnar: Sư iŏk tơdrong pơmat-tat noh wă kơ lu bơngai tơmoi khŭl nai ư-ang 'Bok Kei-Dei, yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm mơnat kơ lu sư mơ̆n. 'Noh kư̆m thoi đe chih roi lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆ thoi âu: “Inh pơư ang anăn Ih kơ lu bơngai tơmoi mă ưh kơ khŭl Juđê, inh hơri ư-ang kơ Ih.”

English: And again he says: “Rejoice, O Gentiles, with His people!”
Bahnar: Păng đe kư̆m đei chih roi thoi âu: “Ơ lu bơngai tơmoi ưh kơ khŭl Juđê, iĕm kư̆m hơdai hiôk thoi lu kon 'Bok Kei-Dei bĕ.”

English: And again: “Praise the LORD, all you Gentiles! Laud Him, all you peoples!”
Bahnar: Đe kư̆m đei chih roi dơ̆ng thoi âu: “Ơ lu bơngai tơmoi ưh kơ khŭl Juđê, bĕ đĭ-đăng kơ bơ̆n jơ̆p kơ teh đak ư-ang 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: And again, Isaiah says: “There shall be a root of Jesse; And He who shall rise to reign over the Gentiles, In Him the Gentiles shall hope.”
Bahnar: Êsai sơ̆ sư kư̆m khan thoi âu: “Đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung Jesê gô đei minh 'nu bơngai iung pơgơ̆r tôm kơ khŭl kon bơngai jơ̆p kơ teh đak. Đĭ-đăng kon bơngai gô gơnang kơ 'Bok ei.”

English: Now may the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, that you may abound in hope by the power of the Holy Spirit.
Bahnar: Yua kơ bơ̆n gơnang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă, na bơ̆n băt chang gô tôm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă ăn kơ bơ̆n. Na inh apinh Sư ăn kơ chăl arih iĕm hiôk hơiă, hiôk-hian yua kơ iĕm lui kơ Sư, na Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơgŭm iĕm băt kơ tơdrong chang gô noh.

English: Now I myself am confident concerning you, my brethren, that you also are full of goodness, filled with all knowledge, able also to admonish one another.
Bahnar: Ơ 'nhŏng oh bơngai Rôm, inh băt mơ̆n iĕm đei đon lui tơpăt na iĕm băt tơgŭm dih băl păng inh băt kơ iĕm hlôh tôm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei na gơh bơtho dih băl tơduă iĕm.

English: Nevertheless, brethren, I have written more boldly to you on some points, as reminding you, because of the grace given to me by God
Bahnar: Mă-lei inh pơ̆n bơtho iĕm yua kơ Sư rơih iŏk inh wă kơ inh jang tơdrong Sư, bơtho lu bơngai tơmoi khŭl iĕm. Thoi noh na inh pơ̆n chih kơ iĕm 'bar pêng tơdrong kơ âu boih wă kơ iĕm 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ tơdrong Sư.

English: that I might be a minister of Jesus Christ to the Gentiles, ministering the gospel of God, that the offering of the Gentiles might be acceptable, sanctified by the Holy Spirit.
Bahnar: Sư wơh inh jang tơdrong Yêsu, bơtho tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei kơ đĭ-đăng lu khŭl tơmoi mă ưh kơ khŭl Juđê, wă kơ lu bơngai noh jing bơngai 'nao 'lơ̆ng tơpăt hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei. 'Noh wă khan dang inh pơyơ̆r lu sư kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, na 'Bok Kei-Dei sơng iŏk lu sư, yua kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng ăn kơ lu sư jing bơngai 'nao rơgoh 'lơ̆ng boih.

English: Therefore I have reason to glory in Christ Jesus in the things which pertain to God.
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh yua kơ Yêsu Krist tơgŭm inh bơtho, na đei lơ bơngai tơpă lui kơ Sư, na dang ei inh hiôk dêh đơ̆ng Sư pơchĕp kơ inh jang tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei âu.

English: For I will not dare to speak of any of those things which Christ has not accomplished through me, in word and deed, to make the Gentiles obedient
Bahnar: Ưh kơ sĭ inh pơma gah tơdrong đe nai ôh. Inh pơma gah tơdrong jang inh mă đơ̆ng Yêsu Krist tơgŭm. Sư tơgŭm inh jang wă anhăk lơ bơngai tơmoi mă ưh kơ khŭl Juđê lui kơ Sư. Sư tơgŭm inh lăm tơdrong bơtho păng lơ tơdrong nai dơ̆ng wă kơ lu bơngai noh lui kơ Sư.

English: in mighty signs and wonders, by the power of the Spirit of God, so that from Jerusalem and round about to Illyricum I have fully preached the gospel of Christ.
Bahnar: Păng dôm tơdrong inh gơh pơm noh đơ̆ng Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơgŭm, mă tơdrong mơsêh, mă tơdrong nai. Thoi noh na inh adrin bơtho tơdrong Yêsu Krist jơ̆p-jang đơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrusalem truh tơ dêh Iliria boih.

English: And so I have made it my aim to preach the gospel, not where Christ was named, lest I should build on another man’s foundation
Bahnar: Inh bơtho tơ anih mă đe ưh tam mă kơtơ̆ng. Inh ưh kơ bơtho tơ anih đe bơtho boih ôh, kơnh dang inh pơm hnam yua đêl jrăng đe chă.

English: but as it is written: “To whom He was not announced, they shall see; And those who have not heard shall understand.”
Bahnar: Inh jang kiơ̆ kơ đe chih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆ thoi âu: “Lu bơngai ưh tam mă kơtơ̆ng gô 'bôh, lu bơngai ưh kơ hlôh gô nhên.”

English: For this reason I also have been much hindered from coming to you.
Bahnar: Đĭ lơ 'măng boih inh wă năm ngôi hơpong păng iĕm, mă ưh kơ yĕng, yua kơ inh oei hăt kơ bơtho lu bơngai mă tam mă kơtơ̆ng tam mă hlôh.

English: But now no longer having a place in these parts, and having a great desire these many years to come to you
Bahnar: Na dang ei inh bơtho jơ̆p-jang boih tơ rim teh đak âu, na inh wă năm tơ iĕm boih.

English: whenever I journey to Spain, I shall come to you. For I hope to see you on my journey, and to be helped on my way there by you, if first I may enjoy your company for a while.
Bahnar: Inh năm tơ iĕm hơdrol, đơ̆ng noh na inh năm tơ dêh Aspanhol. Inh tơchĕng wă ngôi hơpong păng iĕm 'biơ̆ păng inh wă kơ iĕm tơgŭm inh gơh năm tơ dêh Aspanhol noh.

English: But now I am going to Jerusalem to minister to the saints.
Bahnar: Mă-lei dang ei inh năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem hơdrol 'mơ̆i yua kơ đe ată jên athei ăn kơ lu bơngai lui tơ noh.

English: For it pleased those from Macedonia and Achaia to make a certain contribution for the poor among the saints who are in Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Jên noh đơ̆ng lu bơngai tơmoi mă ưh kơ khŭl Juđê tơ dêh Masêđôn păng dêh Grĕk mơnat ăn kơ lu bơngai lui dơnuh hin tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem wă kơ lu sư chă asong băl jên noh.

English: It pleased them indeed, and they are their debtors. For if the Gentiles have been partakers of their spiritual things, their duty is also to minister to them in material things.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă tơgŭm jên noh lu sư lăp đon kơ tơgŭm tơpă, yua kơ lu sư dang hre kơ lu bơngai Juđê, đơ̆ng lu bơngai Juđê bơtho lu sư tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆, noh na lu sư tơgŭm lu bơngai Juđê jên.

English: Therefore, when I have performed this and have sealed to them this fruit, I shall go by way of you to Spain.
Bahnar: Đang inh pơjao kơ lu bơngai noh jên boih, na inh năm tơ iĕm, đơ̆ng noh na inh năm hloi tơ dêh Aspanhol.

English: But I know that when I come to you, I shall come in the fullness of the blessing of the gospel of Christ.
Bahnar: Inh băt mơ̆n mưh truh tơ iĕm kơnh, Yêsu Krist gô tơgŭm inh, wă kơ inh tơgŭm iĕm dơ̆ng.

English: Now I beg you, brethren, through the Lord Jesus Christ, and through the love of the Spirit, that you strive together with me in prayers to God for me
Bahnar: Ơ lu 'nhŏng oh, yua kơ bơ̆n lui kơ Kră Yang bơ̆n Yêsu Krist păng yua kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng ăn kơ bơ̆n đei đon 'mêm mơnat dih băl tơduă bơ̆n bơngai lui, na inh apinh iĕm adrin krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm inh hŏ

English: that I may be delivered from those in Judea who do not believe, and that my service for Jerusalem may be acceptable to the saints
Bahnar: wă kơ lu bơngai ưh kơ lui tơ dêh Juđê huay kơ pơm kơnê̆ kơ inh. Păng inh wă kơ iĕm krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă kơ lu bơngai lui tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem gơh iŏk jên noh.

English: that I may come to you with joy by the will of God, and may be refreshed together with you.
Bahnar: Thoi noh dah 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ inh yĕng năm truh tơ iĕm tơpă lei jơhngơ̆m inh hiôk dêh, inh tơchĕng gơh pơdơh ngôi păng iĕm 'biơ̆.

English: Now the God of peace be with you all. Amen.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch gơh ăn kơ bơ̆n hiôk-hian, na inh apinh Sư oei hơdai đĭ-đăng kơ iĕm. A-men.

English: I commend to you Phoebe our sister, who is a servant of the church in Cenchrea
Bahnar: Âu duch nă bơ̆n yă Phêbê wă năm ngôi hơpong tơ iĕm. Sư bơngai jang lăm hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ Pơlei Sankrê. Sư bơngai 'lơ̆ng, na inh apinh iĕm sơng iŏk sư mă trŏ 'biơ̆ hŏ, yua kơ sư kư̆m hơdai bơngai lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu Krist thoi bơ̆n. Păng inh wă kơ iĕm tơgŭm sư tôm tơmam sư kăl yua, yua kơ sư bơngai tơgŭm đe dêh sơ̆, truh tơ inh sư kư̆m tơgŭm mơ̆n.

English: that you may receive her in the Lord in a manner worthy of the saints, and assist her in whatever business she has need of you; for indeed she has been a helper of many and of myself also.
Bahnar: Âu duch nă bơ̆n yă Phêbê wă năm ngôi hơpong tơ iĕm. Sư bơngai jang lăm hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ Pơlei Sankrê. Sư bơngai 'lơ̆ng, na inh apinh iĕm sơng iŏk sư mă trŏ 'biơ̆ hŏ, yua kơ sư kư̆m hơdai bơngai lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu Krist thoi bơ̆n. Păng inh wă kơ iĕm tơgŭm sư tôm tơmam sư kăl yua, yua kơ sư bơngai tơgŭm đe dêh sơ̆, truh tơ inh sư kư̆m tơgŭm mơ̆n.

English: Greet Priscilla and Aquila, my fellow workers in Christ Jesus
Bahnar: Na dang ei inh wă jet gia tôm kơ iĕm tơ âu: Bĭ bre Prisil păng Akila bre sư thoi yơ dang ei? Sơ̆ bre sư jang tơdrong Kră Yang Yêsu Krist hơdai hăm inh.

English: who risked their own necks for my life, to whom not only I give thanks, but also all the churches of the Gentiles.
Bahnar: Sơ̆ inh đei tơdrong đe wă pơlôch, na bre sư tơdŏng inh, bre sư nuih dêh ưh kơ hli kơ đe wă pơlôch hăm bre sư. Na inh păng đĭ-đăng bơngai lui tơmoi bơnê kơ bre sư tơpă.

English: Likewise greet the church that is in their house. Greet my beloved Epaenetus, who is the firstfruits of Achaia to Christ.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m đei nơ̆r jet gia lu bơngai mă juăt kơ akŭm tơ hnam bre sư. Inh kư̆m đei nơ̆r jet gia Êpanet, inh 'mêm kơ sư tơpă. Lăm dêh Asi sư boih lui kơ Yêsu Krist hơdrol kơ đe.

English: Greet Mary, who labored much for us.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m đei nơ̆r wă jet gia duch Mari, sư jang tơgŭm iĕm gleh tơpă.

English: Greet Andronicus and Junia, my countrymen and my fellow prisoners, who are of note among the apostles, who also were in Christ before me.
Bahnar: Inh đei nơ̆r jet gia bre Andrônik păng Junnia, bre sư 'nhŏng oh inh; sơ̆ bre sư kư̆m oei tơ lăm hnam phak hơdai hăm inh. Lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu Krist kư̆m ư-ang kơ bre sư mơ̆n. Bre sư lui kơ Yêsu Krist hơdrol kơ inh.

English: Greet Amplias, my beloved in the Lord.
Bahnar: Inh đei nơ̆r jet gia Ampliat, inh 'mêm kơ sư yua kơ sư lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu Krist.

English: Greet Urbanus, our fellow worker in Christ, and Stachys, my beloved.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m wă jet gia lăng Uban, sư kư̆m jang tơdrong Yêsu Krist hơdai hăm bơ̆n. Păng inh kư̆m wă jet gia Satach, inh 'mêm kơ sư tơpă.

English: Greet Apelles, approved in Christ. Greet those who are of the household of Aristobulus.
Bahnar: Inh đei nơ̆r jet gia Apelơ, sư đei tơdrong gleh mă-lei sư oei lui kơ Yêsu Krist kơjăp. Inh kư̆m wă jet gia lăng hnam dơnŏ đe Rihtô sư thoi yơ.

English: Greet Herodion, my countryman. Greet those who are of the household of Narcissus who are in the Lord.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m wă jet gia lăng 'nhŏng inh Hêrô păng inh kư̆m wă jet gia hnam dơnŏ đe Narri lu mă lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu Krist.

English: Greet Tryphena and Tryphosa, who have labored in the Lord. Greet the beloved Persis, who labored much in the Lord.
Bahnar: Păng inh kư̆m wă jet gia lăng bre duch Triphen păng duch Triphô, bre sư kư̆m hơdai jang tơdrong Kră Yang Yêsu Krist. Păng inh wă jet gia duch Phersi, inh băt sư jang tơdrong Kră Yang Yêsu Krist gleh dêh na bơ̆n 'mêm kơ sư tơpă.

English: Greet Rufus, chosen in the Lord, and his mother and mine.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m đei nơ̆r wă jet gia Ruphus, đe ư-ang kơ sư tơpă yua kơ sư lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu Krist kơjăp. Inh kư̆m wă jet gia mĕ sư thoi yơ, mă mĕ sư kư̆m dang mĕ inh mơ̆n.

English: Greet Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermas, Patrobas, Hermes, and the brethren who are with them.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m wă jet gia lăng lu đe âu thoi yơ: Asin, Plêgon, Hêmes, Pattrô, Hemmơ păng đĭ-đăng kơ lu 'nhŏng oh mă oei hơdai lu sư.

English: Greet Philologus and Julia, Nereus and his sister, and Olympas, and all the saints who are with them.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m wă jet gia Philô păng yă Jula, Nerê, hăm mŏ mai sư; păng Ôlem păng đĭ-đăng bơngai lui mă oei hăm lu sư.

English: Greet one another with a holy kiss. The churches of Christ greet you.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kơ iĕm jing 'nhŏng oh lui kơ Yêsu Krist, na apinh iĕm sơng iŏk rôp băl ti wă kơ băt tơdrong 'mêm băl. Đĭ-đăng bơngai lui kơ Yêsu Krist rim kơ anih tă leng kơ jet gia iĕm ngăl.

English: Now I urge you, brethren, note those who cause divisions and offenses, contrary to the doctrine which you learned, and avoid them.
Bahnar: Ơ 'nhŏng oh, iĕm athei kơchăng hli kơ iĕm lui jrok kiơ̆ lu bơngai lui ưh kơ tat, hli kơ iĕm achăng lê̆ tơdrong lui tơpăt mă đe juăt kơ bơtho; na iĕm athei weh 'biơ̆ đơ̆ng lu sư. Lu sư wă pơrăm lu bơngai lui bơ̆n, chă pơjah pơjăng păng bơ̆n.

English: For those who are such do not serve our Lord Jesus Christ, but their own belly, and by smooth words and flattering speech deceive the hearts of the simple.
Bahnar: Dôm lu bơngai thoi noh lu sư ưh kơ jang tơdrong Kră Yang bơ̆n Yêsu Krist tơpă ôh, sư jang wă 'me akâu sư kơdih đĕch, sư pơma kơ đe rơngơp dêh, na lu đe mă 'bônh kơ lui kiơ̆ kơ sư.

English: For your obedience has become known to all. Therefore I am glad on your behalf; but I want you to be wise in what is good, and simple concerning evil.
Bahnar: Mă-lei gah iĕm, đĭ-đăng kơ đe băt kơ iĕm lui kơjăp tơpă, thoi noh na jơhngơ̆m inh hiôk dêh. Păng inh wă kơ iĕm hơgei, gơh tơchĕng tơdrong trŏ sư thoi yơ, tơdrong glăi sư thoi yơ. Inh ưh kơ wă kơ iĕm hơgei gah tơdrong kơnê̆ ôh.

English: And the God of peace will crush Satan under your feet shortly. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei wă kơ bơ̆n gơh oei hiôk hăm bôl buăl, thoi noh na Sư ưh kơ ăn kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ pran hloh kơ iĕm, Sư ăn kơ iĕm pran hloh kơ tơdrong kơnê̆; noh dang Sư ăn kơ iĕm juă bơhlơ̆r kơ̆l yang Satan. 'Noh na inh apinh Kră Yang Yêsu Krist wei-lăng iĕm.

English: Timothy, my fellow worker, and Lucius, Jason, and Sosipater, my countrymen, greet you.
Bahnar: Timôthê, sư bơngai jang hơdai inh, sư kư̆m đei nơ̆r jet gia iĕm mơ̆n. Na lu đe âu dơ̆ng kư̆m lei-lăi: Lusiu, Jason, Sôssi, lu sư 'nhŏng oh inh ngăl kư̆m hơdai jet gia iĕm mơ̆n.

English: I, Tertius, who wrote this epistle, greet you in the Lord.
Bahnar: Anăn inh Terruis, Pôl athei inh chih tơgŭm sư kơthơ âu, inh kư̆m hơdai jet gia đĭ-đăng kơ iĕm bơngai lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu Krist tơ iĕm âu.

English: Gaius, my host and the host of the whole church, greets you. Erastus, the treasurer of the city, greets you, and Quartus, a brother.
Bahnar: Na âu akâu inh kơdih Pôl pơma dơ̆ng. Inh oei tơ hnam Guơs păng đĭ kơ nhôn juăt akŭm tơ hnam sư, sư kư̆m đei nơ̆r jet gia pơma dơnuh hăm iĕm mơ̆n.

English: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
Bahnar: Êrat sư bơngai chĕp jên đe pơlei păng bôl bơ̆n Kuat, bre sư kư̆m đei nơ̆r jet gia iĕm mơ̆n.

English: Now to Him who is able to establish you according to my gospel and the preaching of Jesus Christ, according to the revelation of the mystery kept secret since the world began
Bahnar: Bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, Sư boih gơh tơgŭm iĕm lui kơjăp, inh bơtho iĕm tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng Yêsu Krist wă kơ iĕm băt Sư gơh ăn kơ iĕm lui kơjăp. Tơdrong Yêsu Krist âu lu kră sơ̆ ưh tam kơtơ̆ng ôh.

English: but now made manifest, and by the prophetic Scriptures made known to all nations, according to the commandment of the everlasting God, for obedience to the faith
Bahnar: Mă-lei dang ei 'Bok Kei-Dei tơbăt ăn kơ bơ̆n boih, Sư tơbăt ăn kơ bơ̆n lăm tơdrong lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r Sư chih roi sơ̆. Sư wă kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai jơ̆p kơ teh đak băt kơ tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng Yêsu Krist, wă kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai lui kơ Sư.
